rootNode.text: "HELP!" a sudden piercing scream cuts through the air. "HELP ME!" the voice seems to cry out from behind a large boulder. As you approach, you see a body partly crushed by the large boulder. "HELP ME!" you turn around to notice a raven sitting on a nearby branch.

children.text:
You find a purse filled with some gold. You find 46 gold! After pocketing the gold, you are surprised by a sudden noise. "THIEF!" you hear as the raven swoops down and scratches you with its claws before flying away.

You are Bleeding
The raven looks at you with intelligent eyes; a quizzical look on its face.
The raven seems to realize your intent and joins you as you continue your quest. "ADVENTURE!"
After you hand the raven a coin, it immediately starts flying away and screams. "FOLLOW!" The raven leads you to a potion barely visible underneath some branches. "FOR YOU!"

rootNode.text: Well, well, well, aren't you just full of surprises. I never took you for the type to hobnob with the upper crust. But here we are, rubbing elbows with the elite. Do tell, what brings you to this little gathering?

children.text: Theresa smiles and extends a hand. "Theresa Blackbrew, I dabble in the art of alchemy and look for answers to some of its more... elusive secrets."

Theresa chuckles. "I like to think my ambition has outgrown such mundane endavours. Alchemy is the process of change - transformation, and power. Perhaps even the power to cut the strings that most can't even see." "But in the spirit of tonight's festivities, I won't bore you with my thesis on Alchemy, [[class]]. Have you tried the Roasted Sparkstag yet?"

"I couldn't resist the opportunity for some fine dining and bad company. It reminds me of home, in a way." Her tone is light and casual, as if attending such gatherings was a common occurrence for her.

children.choiceLabel: Thank you for telling me this.

children.text: "My pleasure. Now would you care to tell me of the nature of your business, [[class]]? You stand out like a sore thumb amongst these war-wary snobs."

children.choiceLabel: I am looking for a missing merchant.

children.text: Theresa casually sips her wine and smiles. "I had an inkling this visit wasn't strictly pleasure. As for our loud-mouthed friend, he might be better off where he is now. But if you must, have a look at the paintings near the staircase." And do be careful, lest you end up next to him, courtesy of our gracious hosts this evening. Now is there anything else you need, [[class]]?

children.choiceLabel: 20 Gold: Change a card to one of equal rarity
35 Gold: Change a card to one of higher rarity

children.text: "Ah, but of course. A keen eye like yours would have noticed not all here is as it appears - perhaps I can offer my services to give you some advantages during your investigations, [[class]]?"

children.choiceLabel: 20 Gold: Change a card to one of equal rarity
35 Gold: Change a card to one of higher rarity
I'm just here for the drinks.

children.text: "Oh my, then I've got just the thing for you, [[class]]! I stock only the finest potions, renowned for their utility AND exquisite flavours."

rootNode.text: Amongst the paintings near the large marble staircase, various portraits look particularly lively, seemingly moving whenever your attention settles on their flat surface. After a moment, you approach the...

children.text: As you approach the painting, the figure of the soldier trapped inside seems motionless, frozen in time. But as you gaze at the painting, something strange begins to happen. At first, it's just a flicker of movement, barely perceptible. But then, the scene starts to come to life. The soldier begins to move, struggling against invisible bonds, his face contorted with fear and pain. As you watch, the scene becomes more and more gruesome. Blood spatters the walls of the painting, and the soldier's face contorts in agony as a ragged spear skewers its body. It's a terrifying sight, and you feel a deep sense of unease as you watch. But just as suddenly as it began, the scene comes to an abrupt end. The painting returns to its still state, the soldier once again frozen in time. You're left standing there, shaken by the experience. The power of the spell that trapped the soldier inside the painting is evident, and you can't help but wonder what other horrors might be lurking inside the walls of the mansion.

You approach the painting of the hooded figure and as you look closer, you notice something strange happening. At first, it's just a flicker of movement, barely perceptible. But then, the scene starts to come to life. The thief's body begins to move, and you can see them struggling with something just out of view. It's clear they are trying to enter a vault, but something has gone terribly wrong. As you watch, the scene becomes more and more frantic. The thief's body twists and turns, sweat pouring down their face as they try to escape whatever has trapped him inside the painting. But it's no use. With a final gasp, the thief slumps to the ground, their body still as the spell takes them. The painting returns to its still state, the thief once again frozen in time. You're left standing there, a sense of dread settling in your stomach. If the count and countess are capable of this kind of magic, what other dark secrets might be hidden inside the walls of their mansion?

You turn your attention to the painting of the merchant, wondering if it too will come to life like the others. As you stare at it intently, the figure in the painting seems to shift and move. At first, it's just a slight tremble of the body, but soon the painting begins to glow with an eerie light. Suddenly, the merchant's figure steps out of the painting and onto the floor, looking around in confusion. "Excuse me, is this the Vesparin mansion?" he asks, turning towards you. But before you can answer, the figure of the merchant suddenly freezes in place. A strange energy crackles in the air, and you realize with a sinking feeling that the count or countess must have cast their magic at that moment. The merchant's body slowly begins to sink back into the painting, his face returning to the confused expression as caught in the painting once more. Within moments, the painting returns to its still state, the merchant once again trapped inside. You can't help but feel a sense of unease as you consider what kind of power the count and countess possess.

children.choiceLabel: Make a note of the painting and leave.
Make a note of the painting and leave.

rootNode.text: You notice an abandoned backpack leaning against a tree. It appears well-made but weathered, as if it has traveled far. Oddly, no tracks lead to or from it, and a faint shimmer in the air around it catches your eye when you look away. As you approach, an unnatural silence falls. Even the ambient sounds of your surroundings seem muted, as if something is holding its breath, watching.

children.text: The backpack is made of fine leather, stained with a dark substance. Opening it reveals surprisingly dry contents: a leather-bound journal and brass locket.

The journal belongs to someone named Elias Hilt. The early entries document a conventional archaeological expedition, but soon descend into increasingly disturbed ramblings about "entities that watch from angles that shouldn't exist" and "whispers that come when I close my eyes." The final entries are written in a cramped, desperate hand: "They exist in the spaces between thoughts. They promised knowledge, but such wisdom was never meant for mortal minds. The stars have shifted. They are coming. I can feel them taking pieces of me when I sleep." The writing trails off into meaningless scribbles that somehow hurt your eyes to look at directly.

As you shut the journal, a rune appears above the book. It glows for a brief moment before attaching itself to one of your cards. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehowdeeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

children.choiceLabel: Attempt to communicate with the presence

children.text: Drawing on your disciplined mind, you attempt to communicate with whatever presence lingers around the backpack. For a moment, nothing happens. Then, like a door opening in your mind, contact is established. What floods through is not language as you understand it, but pure conceptvast and ancient and utterly alien. "WE ARE THE TIDE THAT RISES BETWEEN UNIVERSES. WE ARE THE EYES THAT WATCH FROM ANGLES UNDREAMT. WE HAVE TASTED YOUR REALITY AND FOUND IT... SUITABLE." Images flash through your mind: stars going dark one by one; a city of impossible architecture beneath an ocean of liquid darkness; beings of immense size moving through void; and finally, yourselfbut changed, serving as a doorway for something to enter your world.

You force the presence out of your mind. The backlash is immediate and painful, but you sense you've earned a reluctant respect from whatever contacted you. "STRONG VESSEL. WORTHY RESISTANCE. WE WILL WATCH YOU." You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

You mentally form a question about their purpose. The answer comes not in words but in sensationshunger, desire, inevitability. They seek transformation. They seek to remake your reality in their image.

Something tells you that taking any of these items would be a grave mistake. You back away from the backpack, leaving everything untouched. As you turn to leave, the air shimmers violently around the abandoned pack. For just a moment, you glimpse something impossiblea tear in reality itself, through which gaze eyes of many sizes and shapes, all fixed on you. A splitting headache strikes you, but with it comes a fragment of knowledge you shouldn't possess.

You stand perfectly still, listening to the silence. But it isn't silent at all. Beneath the threshold of normal hearing, there's a persistent, rhythmic soundlike breathing, but not quite. Like whispers, but without words. The sound seems to come from inside the backpack. Nofrom inside your own thoughts.

It doesn't help. The sounds continue unabated, suggesting they never came from outside at all. "Vessel," something seems to say, though you hear it with your mind rather than your ears. "Soon." When you lower your hands, you find a strange coin in your palm that wasn't there before. You find 15 gold! You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

children.choiceLabel: Concentrate and push back against the presence

children.text: Drawing upon your mental fortitude, you establish a barrier in your mind. The whispering recedes, leaving behind a profound silence. You sense disappointment from... somewhere. As if something reached for you and found only emptiness. You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

You clutch your holy symbol and invoke sacred words. The whispering distorts, becoming a hiss of frustration and pain. "The light burns but cannot last. Darkness is the natural state of all existence." The presence withdraws, leaving behind a crystalline substance on the ground that glows with faint luminescence. You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

Focusing your intellect, you manage to comprehend the seemingly random scrawls. Understanding blooms in your mind like a dark flower. The passage describes entities that exist between dimensionsbeings that feed on reality itself. Thorne apparently discovered how to close the door he had inadvertently opened, but was too late to save himself. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehowdeeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

The brass locket contains a daguerreotype portrait of a severe-looking man in academic robes. As you study it, you realize with growing unease that the subject's eyes seem to be following your movements. The longer you stare, the more the background behind the figure appears to deepen, revealing impossible geometries and a vast darkness populated by distant, watching entities.

You snap the locket shut, a cold sweat breaking across your brow. For a moment, you could swear you heard it whisper your name. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehowdeeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

children.text: Drawing on your disciplined mind, you attempt to communicate with whatever presence lingers around the backpack. For a moment, nothing happens. Then, like a door opening in your mind, contact is established. What floods through is not language as you understand it, but pure conceptvast and ancient and utterly alien. "WE ARE THE TIDE THAT RISES BETWEEN UNIVERSES. WE ARE THE EYES THAT WATCH FROM ANGLES UNDREAMT. WE HAVE TASTED YOUR REALITY AND FOUND IT... SUITABLE." Images flash through your mind: stars going dark one by one; a city of impossible architecture beneath an ocean of liquid darkness; beings of immense size moving through void; and finally, yourselfbut changed, serving as a doorway for something to enter your world.

You force the presence out of your mind. The backlash is immediate and painful, but you sense you've earned a reluctant respect from whatever contacted you. "STRONG VESSEL. WORTHY RESISTANCE. WE WILL WATCH YOU." You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

You mentally form a question about their purpose. The answer comes not in words but in sensationshunger, desire, inevitability. They seek transformation. They seek to remake your reality in their image.

Something tells you that taking any of these items would be a grave mistake. You back away from the backpack, leaving everything untouched. As you turn to leave, the air shimmers violently around the abandoned pack. For just a moment, you glimpse something impossiblea tear in reality itself, through which gaze eyes of many sizes and shapes, all fixed on you. A splitting headache strikes you, but with it comes a fragment of knowledge you shouldn't possess.

You stand perfectly still, listening to the silence. But it isn't silent at all. Beneath the threshold of normal hearing, there's a persistent, rhythmic soundlike breathing, but not quite. Like whispers, but without words. The sound seems to come from inside the backpack. Nofrom inside your own thoughts.

It doesn't help. The sounds continue unabated, suggesting they never came from outside at all. "Vessel," something seems to say, though you hear it with your mind rather than your ears. "Soon." When you lower your hands, you find a strange coin in your palm that wasn't there before. You find 15 gold! You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

children.choiceLabel: Concentrate and push back against the presence

children.text: Drawing upon your mental fortitude, you establish a barrier in your mind. The whispering recedes, leaving behind a profound silence. You sense disappointment from... somewhere. As if something reached for you and found only emptiness. You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

You clutch your holy symbol and invoke sacred words. The whispering distorts, becoming a hiss of frustration and pain. "The light burns but cannot last. Darkness is the natural state of all existence." The presence withdraws, leaving behind a crystalline substance on the ground that glows with faint luminescence. You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

You find yourself unable to look away. The portrait's reality begins to bleed into yoursor perhaps it's the other way around. The boundary between image and observer grows thin. "WE HAVE BEEN WAITING FOR SO LONG." comes a voice from everywhere and nowhere at once. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehowdeeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

Among the belongings, you find a small wooden box containing star charts with unfamiliar constellations, specimens preserved in cloudy fluid, and what appears to be correspondence written in cipher. Hidden in a secret compartment of the box, you discover something truly valuable. You find 15 gold! As your fingers touch the gold, the air around you grows dense, and a voice that seems to come from inside your own head whispers: "A fair exchange. We have marked you now." The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehowdeeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

As you watch from a distance, the air around the backpack occasionally ripples, like heat rising from hot stone. More disturbing is how shadows seem to bend toward it, even when the angle of light doesn't change.
The backpack is made of fine leather, stained with a dark substance. Opening it reveals surprisingly dry contents: a leather-bound journal and brass locket.

The journal belongs to someone named Elias Hilt. The early entries document a conventional archaeological expedition, but soon descend into increasingly disturbed ramblings about "entities that watch from angles that shouldn't exist" and "whispers that come when I close my eyes." The final entries are written in a cramped, desperate hand: "They exist in the spaces between thoughts. They promised knowledge, but such wisdom was never meant for mortal minds. The stars have shifted. They are coming. I can feel them taking pieces of me when I sleep." The writing trails off into meaningless scribbles that somehow hurt your eyes to look at directly.

As you shut the journal, a rune appears above the book. It glows for a brief moment before attaching itself to one of your cards. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehowdeeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

The brass locket contains a daguerreotype portrait of a severe-looking man in academic robes. As you study it, you realize with growing unease that the subject's eyes seem to be following your movements. The longer you stare, the more the background behind the figure appears to deepen, revealing impossible geometries and a vast darkness populated by distant, watching entities.

You snap the locket shut, a cold sweat breaking across your brow. For a moment, you could swear you heard it whisper your name. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. Then, like a door opening in your mind, contact is established. What floods through is not language as you understand it, but pure conceptvast and ancient and utterly alien. "WE ARE THE TIDE THAT RISES BETWEEN UNIVERSES. WE ARE THE EYES THAT WATCH FROM ANGLES UNDREAMT. WE HAVE TASTED YOUR REALITY AND FOUND IT... SUITABLE." Images flash through your mind: stars going dark one by one; a city of impossible architecture beneath an ocean of liquid darkness; beings of immense size moving through void; and finally, yourselfbut changed, serving as a doorway for something to enter your world.

You force the presence out of your mind. The backlash is immediate and painful, but you sense you've earned a reluctant respect from whatever contacted you. "STRONG VESSEL. WORTHY RESISTANCE. WE WILL WATCH YOU." You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

You mentally form a question about their purpose. The answer comes not in words but in sensationshunger, desire, inevitability. They seek transformation. They seek to remake your reality in their image.

Something tells you that taking any of these items would be a grave mistake. You back away from the backpack, leaving everything untouched. As you turn to leave, the air shimmers violently around the abandoned pack. For just a moment, you glimpse something impossiblea tear in reality itself, through which gaze eyes of many sizes and shapes, all fixed on you. A splitting headache strikes you, but with it comes a fragment of knowledge you shouldn't possess.

You stand perfectly still, listening to the silence. But it isn't silent at all. Beneath the threshold of normal hearing, there's a persistent, rhythmic soundlike breathing, but not quite. Like whispers, but without words. The sound seems to come from inside the backpack. Nofrom inside your own thoughts.

It doesn't help. The sounds continue unabated, suggesting they never came from outside at all. "Vessel," something seems to say, though you hear it with your mind rather than your ears. "Soon." When you lower your hands, you find a strange coin in your palm that wasn't there before. You find 15 gold! You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

children.choiceLabel: Concentrate and push back against the presence

children.text: Drawing upon your mental fortitude, you establish a barrier in your mind. The whispering recedes, leaving behind a profound silence. You sense disappointment from... somewhere. As if something reached for you and found only emptiness. You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

You clutch your holy symbol and invoke sacred words. The whispering distorts, becoming a hiss of frustration and pain. "The light burns but cannot last. Darkness is the natural state of all existence." The presence withdraws, leaving behind a crystalline substance on the ground that glows with faint luminescence. You gather what you've decided to keep and step away from the backpack. A faint whisper follows you, just at the edge of hearing: "We will meet again. The stars ensure it."

Focusing your intellect, you manage to comprehend the seemingly random scrawls. Understanding blooms in your mind like a dark flower. The passage describes entities that exist between dimensionsbeings that feed on reality itself. Thorne apparently discovered how to close the door he had inadvertently opened, but was too late to save himself. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehowdeeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

The brass locket contains a daguerreotype portrait of a severe-looking man in academic robes. As you study it, you realize with growing unease that the subject's eyes seem to be following your movements. The longer you stare, the more the background behind the figure appears to deepen, revealing impossible geometries and a vast darkness populated by distant, watching entities.

You snap the locket shut, a cold sweat breaking across your brow. For a moment, you could swear you heard it whisper your name. The air around the backpack feels heavier now, as if something is pressing against the thin veil of reality. You notice that your own shadow seems wrong somehowdeeper and moving slightly out of sync with your body.

Some instinct warns you away from the abandoned backpack. Whatever story lies behind it, you want no part of it. As you turn away, you could swear you hear a faint, disappointed sigh. The hairs on the back of your neck rise as you feel unseen eyes watching your departure.

rootNode.text: A dark plume of smoke cuts above the horizon, painting a jagged scar across the sky. With every step towards the village, the scent of death assaults your senses even stronger.

children.text: You turn a corner around one of the charred houses, only to find a woman clenching her shoulder slumped against the blackened wood. Maki scrambles ahead, drawing her bow before kneeling next to the elderly woman. Roshin?! What- who...

The old shaman coughs, a fragile sign of life returning to her old eyes. "Maki?" she coughs and weakly reaches for the huntress' hand. "What happened here?" "Kaius-..." the old shaman gasps, the thin reflection of life quickly fading from her eyes before her now dead hand slides back into the cold, bloody snow.

"If evil is what you are searching for, stranger - you have found it." "I thought this would get your attention, sister!" a solemn figure shouts, stepping out from the smouldering buildings as he spins a bloodied spear between his hands. "YOU... MONSTER!" Maki shouts, placing another arrow on her bow.

children.choiceLabel: Try to reason with the man

children.text: The figure pauses, his deep, bloodshot eyes gazing at you then back at the huntress at your side. "Consorting with outlanders? Then you are as lost as father said." the man growls as he readies himself for combat.
[Combat]
[Combat]

"Destruction, the desperation of a proud monster, stranger - I..." she pauses and looks up - her cold, icy eyes focussed intently on the destroyed village. "I thought this would get your attention, sister!" a solemn figure shouts, stepping out from the smouldering buildings as he spins a bloodied spear between his hands. "YOU... MONSTER!" Maki shouts, placing another arrow on her bow.

children.choiceLabel: Look for the cause of the destruction

children.text: You look around the now demolished village. Smoke still rises from various collapsed huts and buildings, creating a grim picture of the devastation around you. "I thought this would get your attention, sister!" a solemn figure shouts, stepping out from the smouldering buildings as he spins a bloodied spear between his hands. "YOU... MONSTER!" Maki shouts, placing another arrow on her bow.

children.choiceLabel: Try to reason with the man

[Combat]
[Combat]
Whatever caused this destruction appears long gone. It seems these harsh lands are unforgiving even to those who call it home.

Maki takes her bow off her shoulder. "You are right. You best leave, stranger. I wish I had the strength to guide you to your destination, but I have something I need to do. And this time I won't let others take another arrow for me."
"I... I will not turn down your help stranger. I need to know who did this, wrought this senseless destruction on my village. Please, help me look for survivors."

rootNode.text: The mass of rotting flesh collapses onto the mossy ground. Some of the stiched sinew twitches, as if ready to rise once more without a moments notice.

children.text: In the back of the monstrosity, two ruby daggers are firmly planted in its back.

Two ruby-hilted daggers pierce the back of the fallen monster. Looking closely, you can see that the strikes were precise and the cause of this undeads first death. Pulling the daggers from the back of the corpse, you continue on your way.
You ignite the flesh which starts to smolder and eventually incinerate the body entirely. As you turn to leave, you spot the glimmer of two shiny red rubies on the ashen ground.
You ignite the flesh which starts to smolder and eventually incinerate the body entirely. As you turn to leave, you spot the glimmer of two shiny red rubies on the ashen ground.

children.choiceLabel: Sprinkle Holy Water on the corpse

rootNode.text: You find a desk with several vials, herbs and mushrooms scattered atop its surface, allowing you to concoct a single potion...

[?questflag:stormscarredintro][continue]Welcome back handsome. See anything you like? Anything at all... [?talent:stormscarred;!questflag:stormscarredintro]Oh my, that's quite the look on you. Can I get you anything, handsome? On the house, of course... [?talent:stormscarred;!questflag:stormscarredintro][continue] Well hello there, adventurer. Here for any of my wonderous concoctions or just looking for some... conversation?

children.choiceLabel: 20 Gold: Change a card to one of equal rarity
35 Gold: Change a card to one of higher rarity

rootNode.text: All seems clear until you hear something approaching just a few steps away...

children.text: [Combat]

rootNode.text: Before you stands a colossal tree, its branches reaching skyward like gnarled fingers grasping for the heavens. Something appears to have scorched the bark at its side, cutting a path through the shadows on one side of the tree, while the other side remains cloaked in the shadows cast by the dense canopy.

children.choiceLabel: Look up at the tree's towering branches

children.text: You crane your neck, gazing up at the intricate network of branches. Amongst them, large shadows appear to move from branch to branch. The tree seems to hold a warning in its imposing presence, as if cautioning you of the perils that lie deeper in the Emberwyld Heights. Only the bold and the stupid make their presence known to whatever roams these dangerous realms.
You gather your thoughts and ready your gear, walking down the illuminated path and following the strange trail, unperturbed by the dangers as ancient as the trees themselves.

children.choiceLabel: Stay in the shadows of the tree.

children.text: You gather your thoughts and ready your gear, taking the more cautious route while keeping the strange trail of destruction cutting through the forest in sight.

The bark is rough under your touch, etched with the wisdom of ages yet scarred by fire, leaving a black smear on your fingertips. The tree seems to hold a warning in its imposing presence, as if cautioning you of the perils that lie deeper in the Emberwyld Heights. children.text: Closing your eyes, you listen. The foggy wyld whispers secrets on the wind, a symphony of life and a hint of something darker, lurking unseen. rootNode.text: You find a stone tablet cloven in twain by a large axe, still stuck at the center of the twin pieces of debris.

children.text: "What in th' world" the blacksmith grumbles, scratching the back of his head. "Thats no ordinary axe. I havent seen metal that could cleave granite in a long, long time."

children.choiceLabel: Try to pull the axe free

children.text: You settle your hands around the hilt of the mighty weapon. At first, it resists every attempt to get a good grip on its handle. The object itself feels like it's fighting you, leaving you unable to unsettle the massive axe.

Your fingers reach around the hilt, ignoring the strange resistance of the mighty weapon. As you start to pull, and the blade slides free of the stone with ease, gladly relinquishing its stone prison for the capable grip of your strong hands. Reghar gasps, inspecting the runes that run along the base of the weapon. "A Hellforged weapon. I never thought Id see the day, [[class]]. Id love to work with this and discover its secrets. I might even be able to upgrade your arsenal with metal like this."
The axe seems to bristle as you hand it over to the Blacksmith, though it eventually relents, as it is put to the forges mercy.
The axe seems to approve. It -is- yours. Yours, and yours alone! All of it is yours. And will be yours, and stay yours, and yours forever and ever...
"Shame to leave it like that. It is a work of art. Perhaps there are more of these weapons to be found elsewhere..."

Your fingers reach around the hilt, ignoring the strange resistance of the mighty weapon. As you start to pull, and the blade slides free of the stone with ease, gladly relinquishing its stone prison for the capable grip of your strong hands. Reghar gasps, inspecting the runes that run along the base of the weapon. "A Hellforged weapon. I never thought Id see the day, [[class]]. Id love to work with this and discover its secrets. I might even be able to upgrade your arsenal with metal like this."
The axe seems to bristle as you hand it over to the Blacksmith, though it eventually relents, as it is put to the forges mercy.

children.text: The tome turns to a blank page, and as you confess one of your secrets new runes appear on the leathery paper... "No fun..." - the words echo in your mind as the book suddenly starts to glow a deep, dark purple - then it disappears in a puff of black smoke.

children.text: You dig into the shallow grave, quickly uncovering a small stash of items. As you pry the trinket from the muddy soil, an unsettling groan rises catches you by surprise as a boney claw reaches for your throat!

You extend a hand and whisper a prayer to the Sungod. The small patch of soil lights up briefly. After a moment, a spirit rises from the grave - a thankful expression on his youthful features. "Thank you for freeing me from this damned place, brave soul."
"I am, or rather was, Felwyn, shieldsquire to ser Hamrath of Miranthyne. I beg you, take what's left of our legacy and end these horrors.
The spirit smiles as he starts to fade into a well-deserved afterlife. "Your confidence reminds me of Ser Hamrath hero, may it serve you well..."

rootNode.text: You spot a strange circle on the ground. The glowing symbols are surrounded by candles, all but one flickering ominously...

children.text: The circle glows briefly before it starts to swirl. Moments later, a portal flashes before your eyes, before a large Balor emerges, one flaming claw at a time. "Ah Aethos. It has been a while." The demon growls as it takes a deep, sulfurous breath. "And, it seems I have you to thank, [[class]]. Allow me to bestow my blessing on you, in exchange for my freedom in your realm."

The Balor grins as the mysterious circle fades into the soil. "As wise as you are brave, [[class]]." the demon hums as he leans in. "Do pass on my regards to old Dante. Its nothing short of impressive, what hes done with the place." the demon whispers with a smirk, before disappearing with a violent burst of flames and black smoke.

The Balors eyes go wide, its ember eyes flaring up for a moment, then return to the softly burning glow. "Very well, mortal. If you do not require my considerable favor, be on your way. I am sure someone will take me up on my offer..."

children.choiceLabel: Fight: I wont give you the chance

The demon disappears in a burst of black smoke. Theresa looks doubtful for a moment, leaning in to speak up, then seems to reconsider.

Theresa looks startled for a moment, then smiles sweetly. "Oh, it is nothing dear. It is just, well, can we really afford to refuse such offers of power? Their motives might be.. questionable, but the power they wield is" "Undeniable. Perhaps I am more inclined to the fighting fire with fire argument, but I dont see any harm in strengthening ourselves by the same means our enemies use."

"Of course they are, dear. That is why we should be careful in dismissing them so, ah, casually. Especially those inclined to aid us. These demons play games within games; we might as well play along!"

"Its hard not to run into demons where I come from, dear. The one thing you can be sure of is their over-estimation of their ability to deceive mortals. Once you know the rules, it becomes easier to avoid their traps."

"Valendria. You wouldnt know it, dear. It was overrun by demons long before your time. Its now home to Xenabothulthansiphicus, a lesser pitlord. And a brute that lacks any sort of sophistication. Such a shame."

"Oh yes, dear The rules. Even these demons have their codes and rules, however crude or selfish they may be. Once, a long time ago, it was the humans who made these rules for them! It didnt end well." Bolgar scuffs and interrupts. "And what do you presume to know about these 'humans' that wrote the laws of demons?" Theresa smiles as she lets the smoke of her cigarette flow from between her painted lips. "A lot less than you pretend not to know, 'old' man", then smiles sweetly as Bolgar gestures dismissively.

"That is all I ask. I have no doubt of your abilities, of course, but Ive seen my fair share of heroes come and go. Too proud to make the most of the hand they were dealt! I would just hate to see such a fate befall a hero as handsome as you, dear."

rootNode.text: A woman's pained sobs echo through the area. "Please, help me!" she pleads, her voice trembling. "Bandits attacked my caravan. They... they took everything and left me here to die." Her gaze is filled with desperate hope.

children.text: You study the woman more carefully, noticing subtle inconsistencies. The restraints seem theatrical rather than functional. Her tears leave no trails and her shadow ripples in a way no human shadow should. "Is something wrong?" she asks, her voice suddenly taking on a honeyed quality. "Please hurry... I'm so frightened."

The woman's expression freezes, then transforms into a wicked smile. The air around her shimmers, and her true form is revealed; a succubus with batlike wings, curved horns, and eyes that glow with unnatural hunger. "Well, aren't you a clever one," she purrs, stretching languidly as if relieved to abandon the pretense. The succubus hovers before you, her wings spread wide, her tail flicking with irritation. "Most mortals would be thrilled by my attentions," she says with a dangerous smile. "But those who do not appriciate the velvet hand of The Abyssal Legion will have to deal with the claws!"

The succubus laughs, a sound like dark bells. "So commanding! I do love that in a mortal." She winks at you, circling overhead. "Very well, I'll find easier prey elsewhere. But remember my face, [[class]]. When the Abyssal Legion marches across these lands, I'll make a special point to find you again." With a final blown kiss that leaves a trace of frost in the air, she vanishes in a swirl of dark mist.
"Pity. We could have had such fun." The succubus's smile fades, replaced by cold determination. "If not pleasure, then pain will have to do."

The succubus considers you with newfound interest. "Curious as well as clever. I like that." She drifts closer, though still maintaining a safe distance. "We serve the will of Dantellion. These lands have something he desires greatly  away from the prying eyes of those that hunt him." She smiles cryptically. "My role is simply to be an ambassador of a kind, not all stoop to violence as quickly as my 'kin'."

children.choiceLabel: Attack now that you have information

children.text: "All business and no pleasure. How disappointing." The succubus's expression hardens. "Let's see if you're as formidable as you are observant!"

children.choiceLabel: Warn her to tell her master this land won't fall easily

children.text: The succubus laughs. "Brave words, [class]! I'm sure my Lord will consider them carefully!" She laughs and rises higher into the air until she vanishes in a swirl of dark energy.

children.choiceLabel: Pretend to help while preparing for attack

But remember my face, [[class]]. When the Abyssal Legion marches across these lands, I'll make a special point to find you again." With a final blown kiss that leaves a trace of frost in the air, she vanishes in a swirl of dark mist.
"Pity. We could have had such fun." The succubus's smile fades, replaced by cold determination. "If not pleasure, then pain will have to do."

The succubus considers you with newfound interest. "Curious as well as clever. I like that." She drifts closer, though still maintaining a safe distance. "We serve the will of Dantellion. These lands have something he desires greatly  away from the prying eyes of those that hunt him." She smiles cryptically. "My role is simply to be an ambassador of a kind, not all stoop to violence as quickly as my 'kin'."

children.choiceLabel: Attack now that you have information

children.text: "All business and no pleasure. How disappointing." The succubus's expression hardens. "Let's see if you're as formidable as you are observant!"

children.choiceLabel: Warn her to tell her master this land won't fall easily

children.text: The succubus laughs. "Brave words, [class]! I'm sure my Lord will consider them carefully!" She laughs and rises higher into the air until she vanishes in a swirl of dark energy.

You rush forward to aid the distressed maiden, drawing your weapon to cut her bonds. "Thank you, my savior," she whispers, her voice suddenly taking on a hypnotic quality. As you kneel beside her, she leans close. "Allow me to express my... gratitude." Her eyes begin to glow with an unnatural light, and you find yourself unable to look away. The air shimmers around her as her true form is revealed: a beautiful but deadly demon!

The succubus's spell washes over you, drowning your will in waves of supernatural desire. Time loses meaning as you fall deeper under her control. "That's it, give in," she whispers, her lips against your ear. "Now, a token of your devotion. Give me something precious... a memory, a possession, a piece of your power." "Perfect," she murmurs, pressing her lips to your neck. Her bite is shockingly cold, sending dark pleasure and pain through your body. "A reminder of our time together. Now sleep, my pet. Dream of me." When you awaken, the succubus is gone. You feel weakened, confused, and strangely bereft. The small wound on your neck pulses with supernatural cold.

rootNode.text: Before you stands the statue of Dawnbringer Ystel, carved in the image of strength and divine fury. She holds a large, stone sword, poised as if ready to strike down the demons once more.

children.text: Ystel's figure exudes a sense of heroism and sacrifice. Every detail of her armor and sword is a testament to her legendary battles that first carved a space for humanity into the demon infested lands. Yet, the statue also carries a weight of sadness, a hint of the tragic downfall that befell her.

As you lay a hand upon the stone sword, you feel a surge of respect and a twinge of sorrow. It's as if the stone itself mourns her loss while celebrating her valor. Before you stands the statue of Dawnbringer Ystel, carved in the image of strength and divine fury. She holds a large, stone sword, poised as if ready to strike down the demons once more.

The inscription reads: "Here stands Ystel, Dawnbringer of hope. Her courage outshone the stars until darkness quenched her light." The words end with a somber note, reminding all of her ultimate fate at the hands of demons.

Quietly, you offer words of honor and remembrance for Ystel. Her spirit of defiance and courage continues to inspire those who walk the halls around her effigy. Before you stands the statue of Dawnbringer Ystel, carved in the image of strength and divine fury. She holds a large, stone sword, poised as if ready to strike down the demons once more.
You have no time for nostalgia or reverance. The statue was just another obstacle in your way.

rootNode.text: I see our warnings to leave this place have once again been ignored. Fine, wanderer - if you wish so desperately to test Selandris resolve, then so be it!

children.text: No! The ritual will not be- disturbed...
The hour of Selandris' twilight is nigh, wanderer - not even the Guardian could stop us now...

rootNode.text: You venture deeper into the Emberwyld Heights, following the scarred landscape to an open clearing. The ground underfoot changes, feeling more charred and brittle with each step. A massive crater looms ahead, its edges scarred by some tremendous impact. The air here crackles with an unnatural energy, causing the hairs on your arms to stand on end.

children.text: The ground is littered with fragments of burnt wood and scorched earth. It's as if a great fireball had struck here, but there is no sign of the object that woud have caused such an impact. A massive crater looms ahead, its edges scarred by some tremendous impact. The air here crackles with an unnatural energy, causing the hairs on your arms to stand on end.

You carefully survey your surroundings. The trees around the crater's edge are twisted grotesquely, their branches reaching out as if warped by a powerful force. The wildlife is eerily silent. A massive crater looms ahead, its edges scarred by some tremendous impact. The air here crackles with an unnatural energy, causing the hairs on your arms to stand on end.

In the distance, at the crater's center, a solitary tree stands, glowing faintly. Its light illuminates one side of the crater, creating a stark contrast against the shadowy, debris-filled other half. The decision of where to descend could be crucial.
Drawn to the ethereal glow, you choose to descend on the illuminated side of the crater. The light from the tree casts eerie shadows, but the path here seems less treacherous.

children.choiceLabel: Descend on the shadowy, rocky side

children.text: You decide to approach from the shadowy, rocky side of the crater. This area, laden with debris and broken trees, presents a more challenging path, possibly hiding unknown dangers or discoveries.

rootNode.text: The leader of the bandits staggers, an incredulous expression on his twisted face slowly changing into a bloodied grin. "Lucky hit-... you don't even know what is really going on here do you?" He pauses, coughing up some more blood as he clutches the clearly lethal wound on his chest.

children.text: Garvin snarls and watches his bloodied hand before taking another ragged breath. "You think there's hope here while there is none, [[class]]." *coughs* "There's something those holier-than-thou paladins aren't telling you about this whole- ... endeavour." "But I won't be the one to spoil the surpr-." he growls as the red gleam in his eyes starts to dim and a last gurgled gasp marks the demise of the devious bandit.
With their former leader dead in the mud, the remaining bandits stop their jeering and stare at each other bewilderedly.

children.choiceLabel: Invite the bandits back as Soldiers

children.text: Most bandits look at each other and nod - some more desperate to get out of a clearly losing situation and happy to accept any mercy now that their leader has fallen. Where to next?

children.choiceLabel: You all work for me now!

children.text: None of the bandits seem to want to challenge your claim, some even grunt in hushed approval while others start to show some of their sentience again, sinister smiles curling their lips once more. One of the larger bandits steps forward and extends a gnarly hand. "S'pose this isn't such a bad day afterall. Welcome to the Crimson Crew, boss." Where to next?

children.choiceLabel: Let the militia sort them out

children.text: None of the remaining bandits seems inclined to challenge your claim, most still looking disoriented, as if wondering how they got here in the first place. Where to next?
With a fluent strike you end the bandit's life, his slumped body crumbling to the floor as a black smoke rises from his corpse.

rootNode.text: A cloudy green mist coalesces in the air before you. After a few seconds, a familiar and slightly annoyed voice addresses you. "Ah, [[class]] - how can my arcane abilities aid you in your quest?"

children.text: Memorizing a card will make it Memorized. Cards with this property get shuffled to the top of your deck at the start of combat. Imbuing an Enchantment is a powerful but expensive process that allows you to have an enchantment from your deck be active permanently. The Enchantment card must already be present in your deck, must last longer than a round in order to be imbued, and will be destroyed in the process.

rootNode.text: A magical song fills the air around you. It's beautiful and haunting. You want to keep listening to it forever.

children.text: The song keeps going and it seems to come from no direction you can discern. The music is all around you and you feel your mind starting to go blank.
As you keep listening to the song, nothing else seems to matter. Your mind goes empty. And then suddenly... the music stops. You can't shake the feeling that something is still wrong.
You attempt to cover your ears, but you can still hear the song very clearly. It's both beautiful and terrible, and you can't escape it.

Before the music completely takes over your mind, you quickly stab yourself in your arm. A sharp pain goes through your body, but that might be exactly what you need to keep yourself sane. Eventually the music stops. Your self-inflicted wound hurts, but at least your mind is still your own.
The music keeps going, but you ignore it. Eventually the music stops. Seemingly giving up on trying to affect you.

The three imps look at each other, then all nod as one. "HERO NEED HELP!" they shout as they start loudly making their own music using their makeshift instruments. The music of the imps is much louder than the song you were hearing before. They keep going for a very long time, but at least your mind is unaffected.

rootNode.text: An imp flies up to you and flutters around your head. "CARD? WALKER BUY CARD, YES?!"</color=red>

children.choiceLabel: Take 10 damage: Buy a random Rare.

rootNode.text: Amidst the black vines and ghostly glow of deadly plant life stands a statue of an angel. Thick vines are wrapped around its limbs but they do not diminish the pride the sculptor wanted to eternalize in the dark stone itself. As you admire the statue, it suddenly twists its head into an unnatural angle. "Greetings, [[relation]]. It's been a while. I'm glad you've made it this far once more, I've started to look forward to our little... entanglements."

children.text: "You wound me, [[relation]]. Don't you recognize me? I am your progenitor. But you can call me Ilthar, the first among many to call this beautiful place a home." "Or at least, I was. Until... well. Lets not bring back those painful memories just yet." the statue cracks a smile and tilts its head. "Now what about you, [[relation]]. What brings you to our little garden once again? Have we upset Mother again? Have you come to tell me I've been bad?"
The statue points up. "Our 'Lady of Mercy', or whatever title she has chosen for herself by now. Old flamy, you know." the statue smiles without mirth.

"Ah yes, that's her. Such modesty - a 'Sungod'. Now - Rae 'the Vengeful', 'the Jealous' or 'the Jailor'. Now, that would be fitting." "I see you've got Mothers legendary temper! Fine- if it is a confrontation you seek, you shall have it!"

The statue pauses, reaching for one of the cracks on its shoulder, sickly fleshy ichor pouring from the 'wound' as its narrows its burning eyes. "Fine! I see Mother's fury still burns inside of you! I'll find you once you've unleashed some of that temper on my guests!" the statue snarls, then lifts up into the air and vanishes into the dark canopy above.

Bolgar rubs his bearded chin and looks up. "Ilthar, or at least an image in his liking. A mythical figure, and according to legend, the first angel to abandon Heaven and seek a life amongst mortals." "But - I very much doubt it was him we truly met. That wound, it was bleeding the ichor of Corruption. A most troubling substance, [[class]]. But whoever it is, I doubt we've seen the last of him."
"What? Oh, I'm sorry - I was a little distracted dear. Whoever it was, I hope they come back and introduces himself properly." she adds, waving her hand to her flustered face.
"I see you've got Mothers legendary temper! Fine- if it is a confrontation you seek, you shall have it!"

rootNode.text: A gargantuan suit of armor and bones rests half buried in the ground. The figure's helmet gleams above you, untarnished by centuries of ash and wind. A sickly green substances oozes into the barren ground from the missing segments in its broken armor.

children.text: "Will ye look at that..." Reghar mutters, eyes wide. "Kivos old friend, you deserved better...".

Aye. Kivos Fellheart. A Goliath, said to be a descendant of the Sungod herself. He single handedly turned the tide during the War of Horns. I was just a wee boy, but I remember the faces once we heard the news of his death.

"Aye - I did. My master served under 'im during the War of Horns. And I would 'ave given everything to follow him into the Black Citadel itself. "But I was too young fer soldiering. By the time I was, Kivos had fallen." The grizzled man looks wistfully for a moment, fist clenching around his hammer. And then there's you. Thank ye for indulging an old man, and allowing him a chance to make amends for his past. I dun' know why, but I see much of Kivos in ye, [[class]].
I only heard the tales. Terrible whispers of a battle - nay, a slaughter. Crusaders of Stalwart and demons alike were squashed as bugs beneath a boot.

Stalwart was a shining bastion against the demon hordes. With Kivos at the helm it marked the beginning of a new age. Brightcandle or even Great Candor is but a sputtering flame compared to the blazing glory that Stalwart once was.

Now, a wasteland - but it has served as a no mans land between Umbris and the Shattered Realms, making it hard for either side to fall back into all out war. No army dares cross it, not after what happened at Stalwart. You're closer than you might realise, friend. Except the bugs are still here. Feeding on whatever is left of the misery it caused. And once it had its fill, once it's strong enough... The old man waves his boney fingers, dispersing some of the lingering essence lingering in the air. "There's worse things in this world than mere demons. We best keep moving..."

rootNode.text: A skeleton in highly oxidised yet impressive armor sits against a nearby tree trunk. As you walk past, an ivory hand suddenly grasps at your weapon. "Pleeeeeeease" a hollow howl escapes from the undead's broken jaw...

children.choiceLabel: Rest your hand on the battered skull

children.text: You rest your hand atop the skeletons head and...
The unliving are an affront to the Lady of Mercy. With a satisfying crunch the horror goes silent once more as it falls forward into the mud.

Even the unliving deserve the Lady's Mercy. You rest your hand atop the battered skull, invoking the light. For a brief moment, the skeleton looks hopeful - before the last remaining life fades from its decomposed body.

You recognize the armor as belonging to the Stillguard. Mercenaries with a strict code of honour, usually guarding a wealthy merchant or ambassador. The many decorations on the oxidised armor suggest this soldier held a high rank within the order.
The skeletal figure seems confused for a moment, then nods solemnly, rising the bony hand to its battered skull before its lifeless body stops moving once more.
You carefully remove the armor from the skeleton, but despite your best efforts the dusty bones collapse as soon as you relieve it of its rusty carapace.

children.choiceLabel: Offer the warrior a final salute.

children.text: The skeletal figure seems confused for a moment, then nods solemnly, rising the bony hand to its battered skull before its lifeless body stops moving once more.

children.choiceLabel: Absorb the soul of the warrior

children.text: The many markings on the soldiers armor mark it as a powerful warrior from the Heartland.

You reach for the battered skull and push it back, drawing translucent tendrils of the soul remaining inside into yourself. After a brief moment, the skeleton collapses and is left lifeless once more.

You drop on your knees, pushing back against the skeleton's grasp. Humming the words taught to you by your clan, small roots and dirt start to reach up, claiming what is rightfully theirs until the soldier is completely buried beneath the earth.

children.choiceLabel: Remove a Basic Attack: Give it a weapon

children.text: The skeletal gasps as it slinks back, cradling the simple weapon before its lifeless body stops moving once more.

rootNode.text: Your path is blocked by a large fallen tree, with dense bushes flanking the path on both sides.

children.text: You start to push the tree aside, only to reveal the corpse of a poor soldier caught in the path of the giant fallen tree. The bony fingers of the unfortunate soldier still clutch a small metal case which seems largely undamaged, unlike everything else on the crushed corpse.

children.choiceLabel: (Gain a rare card) Take the case

children.text: You easily scale the large tree. Just as you are about to jump off the other side you spot a massive boar near the roots of the tree. Fortunately, it does not seem to notice you, digging more of the roots free with its huge tusks.
[Combat]
As you start to move around the tree you hear an angry snorting behind you. Near the roots of the fallen tree stands a massive boar. It growls angrily at you before charging in your direction!
[Combat]

rootNode.text: A rather fancy tombstone stands proudly and remarkably distinguished over a heavy slab of stone.

children.text: You dig into the shallow grave, quickly uncovering a small stash of 27 gold!.
You dig into the shallow grave, quickly uncovering a small stash of 27 gold!.

rootNode.text: A small colorful field of flowers stands in contrast to the rest of your surroundings.

children.text: You lie down and fall asleep amid the flowers. After a few hours, you wake up feeling healthy and refreshed.
You carefully pick a beautiful flower from the field.
Bolgar looks surprised when you hand him the flower. "You would waste such a gift on me? Here [[class]], I'll give you something in return."

"We must apologize, but we don't take flowers as payment for our products. You should know Julius Bellthorp is a fair and honest merchant, so we'll buy it from you instead." Julius hands you some money, before you can object. You get 20 gold.
"That's a nice thing you're giving me. A fine trade it is then!"
"Well, isn't this a surprise? Be careful, you might just become my favorite customer."

rootNode.text: A small basin of water reflects the sparse light in your direction. Its glimmer seems strangely radiant, breaking the scattered light into dozens of vibrant colors.

children.text: The water cleanses you, removing all Corruptions from your deck.

rootNode.text: Two tunnels split before you. Each leads further into the complex network of caverns and corridors. What will you do?

children.text: Following the broken-down tracks, you walk into the leftmost tunnel. As your feet carry you forward, the space widens into a large hexagonal cavern. A central pillar branches out towards the six corners of the room, its rotting wood visibly struggling with the stone weight above, keeping the ceiling from collapsing in on the large, crypt-like structure below.

Thin tendrils of gold gleam out from underneath the crypt's door. Despite its size, it slides open remarkably easy. As you set your eyes on the prize behind, an angry howl suddenly drives you back as you reach for your [[weapon]].
As the ghostly figure disappears, the crypt now stands unprotected and its treasures yours to take.
You find 41 gold!
At last, the familiar warm tones of the crystal illuminate the widening walls of the cavern once more. You seem to have made it through the maze of tunnels.
At last, the familiar warm tones of the crystal illuminate the widening walls of the cavern once more. You seem to have made it through the maze of tunnels.
You kick the pillar and the room trembles, threatening to collapse in on itself!

Panicked, you rush towards the exit. Rubble falls around you as you dive into the open doorway and the tunnel collapsed behind you. At last, the familiar warm tones of the crystal illuminate the widening walls of the cavern once more. You seem to have made it through the maze of tunnels.

Rocks pelt your body, leaving ugly bruises as you flee back across the chamber. The chamber collapses behind you, and you suck in ragged breaths in the utter blackness. Two tunnels split before you. Each leads further into the complex network of caverns and corridors. What will you do?
Hugging the rightmost wall, you enter a dark corridor illuminated by scattered pieces of glowing crystal.
Picking up a piece of the orange crystal, you feel various foreign sensations pulse through your mind. With some difficulty, you discern a distinct desire to acquire more of the crystal.
You put the Amber back down, sensing something very wrong about the strange crystal.
Two tunnels split before you. Each leads further into the complex network of caverns and corridors. What will you do?
You continue forward and the walls of the corridor narrow. Closing in on you with each step you take, until you can no longer fit through.
Two tunnels split before you. Each leads further into the complex network of caverns and corridors. What will you do?

You nimbly maneuver yourself through the narrow passage and reach the other side unscathed.The Amber gleams more potently, the warm hues reflected by the veins of pure gold coursing through the crystalline formations.
You find 36 gold!
You find 61 gold!
You find 113 gold!

You find a nice hefty rock, and smash your way through the passage, widening it until you can pass through unscathed.The Amber gleams more potently, the warm hues reflected by the veins of pure gold coursing through the crystalline formations.
You find 36 gold!
You find 61 gold!
You find 113 gold!
You angle yourself to push through the narrow passage, only to find yourself well and truly stuck.

After abandoning some of your gear, you tumble out at the far end of the tunnel. The Amber gleams more potently, the warm hues reflected by the veins of pure gold coursing through the crystalline formations.
You find 36 gold!
You find 61 gold!
You find 113 gold!

rootNode.text: You spot a small black box on a pedestal. The container itself is richly decorated with gold and gemstones shaped like spiders.

children.text: As you stash the gold somewhere safe, black smoke starts to rise from the mysterious box and a soft laughter fills your ears...

rootNode.text: A golden idol stands proudly atop a lone pedestal.

children.text: As you reach for the idol, its ruby eyes start to glow.
You quickly turn your head and manage to shield your eyes before taking the idol, quickly stuffing the strangely heavy object in your backpack.
You quickly cover the ruby eyes with your hands before taking the idol, quickly stuffing the strangely heavy object in your backpack.
You quickly smash the statue, sending its ruby eyes flying. After a quick search, you pocket both gemstones and what was left of the gold.
Your vision blurs as an unknown amount of time passes. You wake up only to find yourself in the middle of a clearing, with the idol nowhere in sight...
After some tinkering, a satisfying click seems to have disabled the traps hidden inside the luminous pedestal.
You quickly smash the statue, sending its ruby eyes flying. After a quick search, you pocket both gemstones and what was left of the gold.
"Wait, wait! We can't just leave this thing of... magnificance!" The old man turns and reaches for the idol.
You quickly grab the old man's arm. He pulls free, then pauses. "Sigh. You are right. It does seem a little too convenient. Thank you, [[class]]"."

You reach for the old mans arm, but it's too late. As his fingers touch the golden statue, its ruby eyes start to glow. Your vision blurs as an unknown amount of time passes. You wake up only to find yourself in the middle of a clearing, with the idol nowhere in sight...

As his fingers touch the golden statue, its ruby eyes start to glow. Your vision blurs as an unknown amount of time passes. You wake up only to find yourself in the middle of a clearing, with the idol nowhere in sight...

name: Grove of the Dying Star  Finish

rootNode.text: As you strike the final blow, the eyes of the spirit flicker briefly. Its breath slows down, whispering in a language unknown to you. "Merakash ara nul..." Slowly, the spirit starts to rise - the blind rage gone as it takes in the destruction it caused. "So much pain..."

children.text: Has it been so long not even my name survived? It is, perhaps for the better. Our time has long passed. It was on our watch as caretakers, the Garden descended into this... hellscape. Perhaps, the young Gods will fare better. I am MeaAnash - or The Guardian of the Garden in your tongue. I was once, long ago, the caretaker of what you now call Aethos. The spirits attention shifts to the clearing around you as intense feelings of sadness wash over you.

The spirit lifts one of its massive paws off the corpse of one of the ritualists. "Foolish creatures. They should have died with the goddess. Instead, they sought to resurrect her, infusing her with what little power of ours lingered amongst these ruins." I do not blame them for trying to restore what was lost. But I condemn them for their foolish belief in the unholy whispers of new gods that have no doubt planted this seed of corruption.

Yes, [[class]]. What else should I call these beings I sense but can not name. Even in my weakened state, I sense their violent, adversarial nature that would rival the primals in power, brimming inside a corrupted shell.

Selandris was once a bright and beautiful star. Its warm and loving glow gave this world its well-earned name: MeaNathal. The Garden. An example of life and harmony amidst a swirling tide of chaos. And when Selandris died, so too did her Garden. These creatures thought restoring Selandris by some unholy means would return this world to its former glory. They were willing to pay any price, making them an easy vassal for the evils that now call this graveyard their home.
"We will dissipate over time, returning our essence to the Garden. In saving me you have given these lands a chance to heal."

children.choiceLabel: I need to get back, Spirit

children.text: "Then leave with our blessing. Know the woods will trouble you no longer, and you have found yourself an ally in the fight against this corruption."
"We will dissipate over time, returning our essence to the Garden. In saving me you have given these lands a chance to heal."

children.choiceLabel: I need to get back, Spirit

children.text: "Then leave with our blessing. Know the woods will trouble you no longer, and you have found yourself an ally in the fight against this corruption."

rootNode.text: The two nobles stand close together, their faces mere inches apart as they argue. Their voices are low and intense, but the words they exchange are sharp and biting.

children.text: "We cannot remain idle and wait for the demons to strike! The Dawnbringer is a clear sign the Gods have taken notice, and we must follow him with unwavering faith. Sowing doubt at this hour will only serve to increase our losses before our inevitable victory." "Your blind faith in some charismatic zealot is as reckless as it is foolish. We must rebuild our defenses, and trust in nothing but our own strength and wisdom. This 'Dawnbringer' might as well lead us to our doom, and then who's left to defend the Shattered Realm?

children.choiceLabel: She's right, we can not waver now

children.text: The noblewoman's expression softens as you agree with her. "I am glad to see some still understand the importance of faith. Some who resist the hesitation and fear that so easily takes hold of those weak of heart and spirit." She nods in approval, pleased to have found a like-minded ally. The nobleman's face contorts with frustration. "Have you both lost your senses? Trusting in the promises of this so-called saviour without a thought is the height of foolishness! This 'Dawnbringer's' true intentions are still a mystery yet you sound eager to let him condemn many brave men and woman to a certain death." Both nobles turn back to each other, continuing their argument without interruption.

children.choiceLabel: He's right, this war seems reckless

children.text: "I am glad to see that you understand the importance of taking a calculated approach. We cannot risk the lives of our people on blind faith alone. We must act with wisdom and prudence if we hope to emerge victorious." The other noble's expression hardens, as if disappointed. "This is what your words accomplish - this stranger seems to share your lack of conviction. The Dawnbringer is our only hope to vanquish demons. Without faith, we have lost already." Both nobles turn away in silence, staring out of one of the tall windows of the Vesparin Mansion overlooking the stretching wasteland of Umbris.

You raise your hand, seeking the attention of both nobles. "Why can't we follow the Dawnbringer's lead and momentum, while we bolster our defenses at home with the help of The Stillguard? These borderland mercenaries can aid us in training our troops and improving our fortifications." If the Radiant Crusade is successful in breaking into Umbris, we can funnel new forces to join the Dawnbringer while strengthening our supply lines and fall back position near the border. The two nobles fall silent, their faces thoughtful as they consider the compromise. They exchange glances and while neither noble wants to admit defeat, they both seem to consider the argument a suitable compromise. Without a word, they turn and leave the room, each lost in their own thoughts.

While the two nobles continue to argue fervently, you skillfully move closer while scanning the room for any potential witnesses. You deftly slip their hand into the pocket of one of the nobles and withdraw a small, leather pouch. You find 16 gold!

rootNode.text: You stare into the mirror-like shard, and you feel as though you are looking backwards in time. The possibilities unravel behind you. Time slips between our fingers, but you can steal a glance of a single time if you concentrate deeply.

children.text: In the vastness of space, a star is born. From this fiery ball of gas and dust, planets begin to form. One planet in particular stands out, a paradise world of lush forests and crystal-clear oceans.

Life flourishes on this planet, with a diversity of species and ecosystems unlike any other. From a distance, it shines like a jewel in the darkness of the cosmos, a testament to the wonder and beauty of the universe.

You see a lush, green landscape stretch out before you. Lush mountains decorated by vibrant flower patches, where animals seem to live in peace. Yet all you sense is a feeling of deep sadness and solitude.

Slowly, the feeling starts to grow into an excited madness. You know what you must do - and you are willing to make the sacrifices required of you. Moments later, darkness starts to evelop the vision, like ink dropping into a clear glass of water...
The fiery abyss quakes with fury as I sense the end approaching. My heart beats faster with fear, realizing I've been cast out by someone stronger, just as I had in my rise to power.
[Choice point]
In the vastness of space, a star is born. From this fiery ball of gas and dust, planets begin to form. One planet in particular stands out, a paradise world of lush forests and crystal-clear oceans.

Life flourishes on this planet, with a diversity of species and ecosystems unlike any other. From a distance, it shines like a jewel in the darkness of the cosmos, a testament to the wonder and beauty of the universe.

You see a lush, green landscape stretch out before you. Lush mountains decorated by vibrant flower patches, where animals seem to live in peace. Yet all you sense is a feeling of deep sadness and solitude.

Slowly, the feeling starts to grow into an excited madness. You know what you must do - and you are willing to make the sacrifices required of you. Moments later, darkness starts to evelop the vision, like ink dropping into a clear glass of water...

I summon all my remaining strength and dive through a portal, feeling its pulsating energy around me. Moments later, I emerge, gasping for breath, on a lush and vibrant garden planet and know that it will serve as my new home.
[Choice point]

children.text: You find 18 gold! As you prepare to leave you suddenly hear a loud squawking from above as a large, black-feathered bird descends on you!

rootNode.text: Welcome back, [[class]]. Here to witness the impossible become possible? Or would you like me to hold onto a card for you?

children.text: I offer two services. First, I can help you safely store a basic version of any card for you to retrieve later. [Cards in the Vault persist between runs]. The vault can hold up to 4 cards. However, if you want to add a new card after the 4th, you'll have to remove one first. Or I can use my talents to create a perfect copy of a single card. The choice is yours, [[class]].

rootNode.text: "HEY YOU!" a shrill voice calls out from the darkness. "YOU-" it adds as a plump imp flutters into view, quickly followed by a second one, slapping two large bones together with each word. "ARE- YOU- A- HERO?!"

children.text: A third imp staggers out from the darkness. "OUR OLD HERO DEAD." then points at the half eaten corpse behind it. "YEAH HE NOT SO GOOD HERO." a third imp adds, plucking sadly at the single string strung onto a large femur bone.

children.choiceLabel: I suppose I am somewhat of a hero myself

children.text: The imps tumble over eachother as they approach you, looking you up and down before they nod. "A NEW HERO!"
The imps smile at each other, immediately starting to bang their makeshift instruments loudly as they fall in line.

children.choiceLabel: No, no get away from me!

children.text: You try to speak to the imps, but they ignore you and continue hammering away on their instruments. Anger pours through your veins and you begin to feel giddy listening to their 'music'.
"OHHHH MYSTERY." one imp gasps. The other nudges the first. "YAH, HERO DON'T SAY THEY ARE HERO!" at which the third imp blowing into a large hornshaped bone pauses and points. "A NEW HERO!"

children.choiceLabel: No, no get away from me!

rootNode.text: Two large iron gates block the exit. "Give me a moment to cleanse this seal, [[class]]. I will channel the sun's power to open these doors! As the priestess starts to channel her spell, a shape starts to emerge from the strange runes on the heavy doors, its tattered robes swirling around its incorporeal body, a wicked grin decorating its skeletal features. "Sooooo loooong... It's been soo long...." As the Lich disappates, the large Iron Gates swing open. "It... it is done, [[class]]. No demon-forged seal will hold us back." From deep within the mines, you hear a high-pitched giggle echoing down the dark mineshafts. "This one even has a little hat! Best. Puppets. EVER!"
A statue stands in the ruins of what once was a temple in honor of the Lady of Mercy, her broken wings embracing bare shoulders leading down towards folded hands below a small, golden plate.

children.choiceLabel: Take the gold on the plate

children.text: You gain 20 gold! As you turn to leave, you feel the presence of the Goddess of light condemn you...

children.choiceLabel: Take the gold on the plate

children.text: "Please leave those offerings to the Lady of Mercy."
"The Lady of Mercy, the Lady of Light and the Forgiving Mother is the one who watches over all of us. They created our new Sun, and provided sustenance to Aethos."

"Our teachings are conveyed through prayer. If we make it out of here, I'd love to show you the City of Candor - an entire nation built in her honor. For now, I can only guide you to her presence, but it requires a token of your dedication, [[class]]."

children.choiceLabel: 50 Gold: I'd like to earn the Lady's favor

children.text: The priestess nods solemnly and starts a prayer as you ceremoniously place the golden coins on the small plate. "... and the Light guide you, forevermore."

children.choiceLabel: I don't have that kind of gold

children.text: Viola nods. "Patience is one of many of the lady's virtues. You might find her in time."
The priestess smiles and bows elegantly before statue, silently instilling her blessing on you.
Viola nods. "Patience is one of many of the lady's virtues. You might find her in time."
The priestess smiles and bows elegantly before statue, silently instilling her blessing on you.

The priestess smiles bemusedly. "She sure is. And she needs that gold more than we do out here. All around the lit world, we pay tribute only to give it back to those who need it most. As the Lady intended." The priestess smiles and bows elegantly before statue, silently instilling her blessing on you.
The priestess smiles and nods. "Of course, [[class]]." then waves a hand at the statue, instilling her blessing on you.
You gain 20 gold! As you turn to leave, you feel the presence of the Goddess of light condemn you...

rootNode.text: The statue of Lightmarshal Lucius stands tall and imposing, his gaze fixed eternally forward, a testament to his unwavering commitment to the Vigil. The air around it feels charged, as if the statue itself is still guarding the hallowed halls.

children.text: As you look closer, you can see the intricate details of his armor and the symbols of valor. His expression is stern, yet there's a hint of sorrow for the countless lives lost under his command.

As your hand touches the cold stone, you feel a subtle vibration, as if the spirit of Lucius himself acknowledges your presence. The statue of Lightmarshal Lucius stands tall and imposing, his gaze fixed eternally forward, a testament to his unwavering commitment to the Vigil. The air around it feels charged, as if the statue itself is still guarding the hallowed halls.
You notice an inscription at the base of the statue. It reads: "In eternal service, the light guides, the shadow retreats."

children.choiceLabel: Say a prayer to Lightmarshal Lucius.

children.text: As you utter the words of respect and remembrance, a faint light begins to emanate from the statue, enveloping you in a warm, protective glow. "The valor of the Radiant Forces shall shield me." You whisper, feeling the air shift around you. A voice, ancient and powerful, echoes in your mind: "Lightmarshal Lucius's ward is upon you, wanderer. Go forth with the light's protection." You feel a surge of energy, a protective ward forming around you. The statue's gaze seems to soften, and you feel you've been granted an ally in the approval of the great commander.

You have no time for nostalgia or reverance. The statue was just another obstacle in your way.
