rootNode.text: A soft wailing emerges from the shadows. As you step closer, you discern the shape of a ghostly figure standing over a shallow grave. [?questflag:priest]"This soul is an ancient one, hero. Nextraphas is no ordinary name She speaks from a time long forgotten. Allow me to guide it home." The ghost turns, revealing the face of a young girl. Hollow eyes bleeding glistening tears, as they roll down ghostly cheeks. "Mommy, Nextraphas spilled the tea~"

children.text: The spirit looks up, as if hearing you speak. "Mommy?" - it smiles and runs a lap around the unmarked gravestone. "Em-ly, Em-ly!"

children.choiceLabel: Write the name on the gravestone

children.text: The ghostly figure smiles, shape slowly fading into its surroundings, as words appear on the empty tombstone. "In loving memory of Emily."
As you prepare to leave, Bolgar looks back at the grave, his stern expression briefly betraying a sense of longing, before he plants his cane firmly into the soil and continues walking.

children.choiceLabel: Remove a random card: Light a candle

children.text: The ghostly figure looks at you curiously as you sacrifice one of the cards. The ritual seems to soothe her, as the soft glow around the girl seems to fade, until it's gone completely. The ghostly figure smiles, shape slowly fading into its surroundings, as words appear on the empty tombstone. "In loving memory of Emily."
As you prepare to leave, Bolgar looks back at the grave, his stern expression briefly betraying a sense of longing, before he plants his cane firmly into the soil and continues walking.

You reach for the scythe. The ghostly figure at first mistakes your intentions for help, but soon recognizes the magic of the unholy weapon "No! No, no, it wasn't me, it was Nextraphas!" she whimpers before a hollow cry fades into oblivion.

Viola stares horrified at the gravestone. What did you do?! That was unforgivable! The Lady of Mercy truly tests me this day. Theresa chuckles. "Easy now dear, don't lose sight of our bigger goal, here. We should be prepared to offer a lot more than a single soul if we want to survive out here."

children.choiceLabel: Viola is right, I shouldn't have done that

children.text: "Thank you [class], it soothes my heart to hear you say that. Mercy is always available to the remorseful."

children.choiceLabel: Theresa is right, we should use all we can to survive

children.text: "Of course I am right, dear! If we won't use the powers this world has to offer, what claim do we have to it to begin with?"

You extend your hand, channeling the energy of your deity as your lips utter a brief prayer. Within moments, the spirit's expression changes - drawn towards something in the distance as its incorporeal form fades...

children.choiceLabel: Priest: Viola, can you cleanse this soul?

children.text: Viola starts a gentle chant. The ghostly figure gasps, listening intensely to the solemn lullaby, form slowly fading into its surroundings as words appear on the empty tombstone. "In loving memory of Emily."

rootNode.text: "B-bastards... all of you..." Maki slumps over, lifeless. The old seer leans down and plucks the amulet from the lifeless corpse of the huntress. "As promised." she smiles a toothy grin, handing you the broken amulet. "As for the other half, we will need to have a 'word' with the chieftain himself - I doubt he will relinquish it easily, but you have proven yourself more than capable."

children.text: "I didn't think you had it in you, [[class]] - but there is something about you. Perhaps you do understand what is needed to not only survive, but to thrive in these harsh times." "As such, I can instil some of my patrons power in you - for a small price. Will you accept his gift?"
The old seer suddenly slices the back of your hand with a knife, then grips it firmly as she leans in uncomfortably close. "Then take this power, and wield it proudly, hunter of the Wildscars."
"Very well, perhaps I have misjudged you after all. Time will tell."

rootNode.text: A thick layer of soot and ash obscures much of the structure. The fortress now looks more like a tomb than a keep, a monument to a time long gone and a reminder of the price that was paid for its defence. It's not much to look at now but I've seen the tapestries that depict it. It was a marvel - a radiant reflection of that twisted Citadel up ahead. If we 'ave a moment, I'd want to see what remains of these Halls.

children.text: As you enter the interior, you are greeted with a musty smell and a dimly lit atmosphere, with dust and cobwebs coating every surface. Debris litters the floor, and the stones are stained and pitted. The main hall appears to have three separate hallways leading to various areas of the fortress.

As you enter the library of the fortress, you are struck by the musty smell of old books and the quiet atmosphere that surrounds you. One book in particular catches your attention, and seems to describe some sort of ritual for releasing Anima.

With the ancient tome in hand, you carefully follow its instructions. The air grows lighter, dust and cobwebs are carried away, and sunlight starts to break through the dusty windows. Anima in the Godscar Wastes is reduced by 30.

children.choiceLabel: Pick up a volume containing powerful spells.

children.text: You flip through the pages of the time, noting several different sections:

children.choiceLabel: Look at the Dark Arts section
Pick up a volume containing powerful spells.

children.text: You flip through the pages of the time, noting several different sections:

children.choiceLabel: Look at the Dark Arts section
Pick up a volume containing powerful spells.

children.text: You flip through the pages of the time, noting several different sections:

children.choiceLabel: Look at the Dark Arts section
Pick up a volume containing powerful Hymns.

children.text: You pick up a heavy tome that doesn't appear to contain the usual studies of the arcane or the divine, but instead holds ancient trading records of place lost in time.
You look over the ancient chart sprawled out on the crooked table. Somehow, the patterns seem otherworldly, yet familiar - hinting at untold secrets only the sharpest mind could see.

As you cautiously enter the armory, the air is thick with the musty scent of rust and leather. Dim shafts of light filter in through cracked and broken windows, illuminating the rows of rusted and worn weapons and armor.

You glance over the weapons as Reghar picks up a sword and studies it for a moment. "You better 'old on to this one. It don't look like much, but it's got potential." The sword looks unremarkable, yet you feel a hint of power just brimming beneath its faded steel surface.

As you cautiously enter the armory, the air is thick with the musty scent of rust and leather. Dim shafts of light filter in through cracked and broken windows, illuminating the rows of rusted and worn weapons and armor.
At the very centre of the hall stands a large forge. Despite its deteriorated surroundings, the forge seems to still be in working order.

As you cautiously enter the armory, the air is thick with the musty scent of rust and leather. Dim shafts of light filter in through cracked and broken windows, illuminating the rows of rusted and worn weapons and armor.

Reghar smiles, perhaps for the first time since you met the grizzled blacksmith. Pushing both his sleeves over his bulky arms he pulls the bellow down, and a single spark ignites the massive forge as it roars into life. "She's a beauty..." Reghar gasps, picking up one of the pieces of dusty, unworked steel.

children.choiceLabel: Can you make me a weapon?

children.text: The blacksmith nods and wastes no time putting the iron into the glowing embers, casting warm tones all around the decrepit armory.
The blacksmith nods and wastes no time putting the iron into the glowing embers, casting warm tones all around the decrepit armoury.

children.choiceLabel: Usher some Anima into the forge

children.text: With the help of Reghar you keep the forge going long enough to usher some of the lingering Anima into the forge, the sickly trails seemingly eager to accept the invitation. Anima in the Godscar Wastes is reduced by 20.

As you step into the treasury you're greeted by a desolate sight. The vast majority of the chests and containers that once held the riches of the fortress are now empty, with only a few trinkets and a single strongbox remaining.
Most of the items are worn and dull, bearing the marks of countless hands that have passed them by. However, amidst the rubble, you spot a glint of something that catches your eye.

You approach the strongbox in the centre of the treasury, noticing its heavy construction and lock. After working the lock open with your trusty lockpicks, you pry the lid open to reveal a pile of glittering gold coins and jewels!

I approach the strongbox in the centre of the treasury, noticing its heavy construction and lock. After working on the lock for what seems like an eternity, you have no other option but to leave the chest as you found it.

rootNode.text: [Combat]
Somehow in this unwelcome waste, you gaze upon the unmistakable barrel sized hole in the ground of a molekin burrow. They really can survive anywhere...

children.text: Continuining on your journey, you put the burrow and its potential occupants out of your mind.

The muffled wimpers of a wounded molekin echo hauntingly in the dim light as you scramble into the burrow. A mangy molekin gazes at you, a bundle clutched to their bloody chest. A few beggarly tools and chests clutter the nooks.

The wounded beast stares at you silently, as you rancasck his home and find a few potions among the knicknacks and bobbles. With a final glare at the molekin, you slither out the hole, feeling sickened.

children.choiceLabel: Kill the molekin and take his bundle.

children.text: A swift strike of your [[weapon]] puts the molekin out of his misery. In their last dying gasps you hear them utter an unsettling curse as you pry the bundle from their claws.
The molekin whimpers, clutching the wound in its fur.
"New leader say they own all now! We was supposed to share, work for all molekin." They motion to the bloody wound across their fur.
You reassure the molekin, and move to heal his wounds as a warm golden light fills the burrow and the gashes knit together. "Th-thank you, [[class]]."
They motion to scars in their fur. "Big fight! New leader bad, wanted to take my stuff! But it didn't - kept it all. Maybe you should have one too? Trade for weapon..."

children.choiceLabel: Give a weapon: Accept the trade.

children.text: You hand the molekin a weapon and accept the item in gratitude. You feel the molekin will be alright and leave the burrow. The creature smiles. "Good friend!" it says, seemingly already becoming more familiar with the word before it turns, and burrows into the sandy ground below, disappearing from sight.

children.choiceLabel: Give a weapon: Accept the trade.

"Good friend!" it says, seemingly already becoming more familiar with the word before it turns, and burrows into the sandy ground below, disappearing from sight.
You decide to have a meal with the molekin instead and leave after several hours feeling greatly refreshed at their friendship and hospitality.

rootNode.text: Your next step is greeted with a precarious 'SPLOSH' as you feel your foot sinking into a strange puddle.

children.choiceLabel: Dexterity: Grab hold of a nearby branch

children.text: You manage to pull yourself free before the strange puddle pulls you in any further, releasing you with an unsatisfied belch.

You scramble to find anything to grab hold of as you feel the puddle close in around your waist. Finally, your fingers find purchase and you manage to pull yourself free - but not without considerable damage to some of the cards in your deck.

rootNode.text:
The wagon takes 25 damage!

A sudden explosion rouses your attention. Black smoke rises from underneath the carriage, leaving one of its wheels destroyed. "Oh my, he-he-he! Looks like you've stumbled into a little present of MINE! How about we avoid more explosive surprises and we both MINE our own business?" the creature hisses as he points a large, rusty wrench at the wagon.

children.text: "Me?" the large, mole-like creature gasps. "I am the undesputed king of kaboom of this road! Now drop that tribute before you hit another one of my surprises!" the creature growls as he waves his wrench at the wagon behind you.
"What?! Guardian? What are we paying you for! Fight these miscreants at once!"

"You... you quit?! That's not allowed- this isn't in the contract! We protest!" "He-he-he, seems youve MINED your manners! Watch your feet, [[class]]- we might be back for the rest!" the creature taunts, grabbing a large sack from the wagon before disappearing back into the thick grain.

"He-he-he! A fight you want, a fight you get!" the creature shouts as he hops back into the golden grain, quickly disappearing from sight. "Bah, common bandits. Just what we needed. We suppose we will set up camp here for the night while you repair the wagon and continue come morning."

"Us? Repair this wagon? What a preposterous proposal! It is stipulated by contract clause 164.2, section C that the contractee, meaning -you-, will provide safe passage, up to and including compensating any damages suffered during the process of this contract."
"While I appreciate your negotiation tactics, we simply cannot accept such terms. See us through safely, and the Emporium will reward your competence. That is the best we can offer."

rootNode.text: You spot a stack of wooden crates, abandoned and unopened. Each dark-wood box is branded with the symbol of a Emporium's Raven, a black bird with its long claws around a pair of scales.

children.text: "How curious. The Emporiums cargo left out here in the middle of nowhere? It must have been meant for us, given that we are the ranking- and only - representative of the Guild out here."

"By Telexpress of course. The Emporiums patented teleporting system. Its far too complicated to explain, even if we didnt sign many, many NDA's detailing the various gruesome ways in which we would be dismembered, should we break these most sacred of contracts." "As sophisticated as the Telexpress may be, it obviously isn't flawless, if it ended up sending precious Emporium merchandise into the middle of nowhere. Oh, the paperwork alone will take us hours, nay - days - to write!"
"We must protest! These are Emperium goods! If they find out we were involved in opening these crates without the proper paperwork, they will take it right out of our bi-monthly earnings!"

You open the crates with a hefty blow of your weapon. Immediately, the stench of rotting flesh overwhelms you, as a corpse slumps lifelessly from the wooden box. You've been Poisoned The merchant stands agape at the revealed cargo. "Did we say days of paperwork? Better make that at least a week This is most unusual."
"We... we do not know! Best not assume the worst. It must have been some clerical error. Or perhaps some unlicensed stow-aways. There is no way to be sure, without the shipping manifest."

The corpse appears to be male, dressed in poor mans clothes, hands bound by simple chains. Several scratch marks are still visible on the inside of the wooden box, wood splinters leaving visible damage on the mans hands and fingers.
"Yes, that does seem curious. Almost - No, no we wont have it! It was probably some unfortunate mix-up, as our report will no doubt uncover. For now, best not to dwell, wouldnt you say, [[class]]."

The other crates contain an assortment of various trinkets and unremarkable items - more in line with the usual trade the Emporium is known for throughout the realm. "A most disturbing find, [[class]], we can't approve of breaking Emporium regulations, but this was certainly... unexpected.

rootNode.text: You tread cautiously through the dense, imposing forests of Emberwyld Heights. The sounds of distant roars and rustling leaves surround you. Suddenly, the trees part, revealing a hidden glade. A sense of tranquility washes over you as you step into the glade. It's an oasis of calm, with gentle sunlight filtering through the leaves as large, imposing creatures gather to drink from a crystal-clear pond.

children.text: The glade is a tapestry of vibrant wildflowers and softly glowing moss. You notice some of the animals watching over others as they drink, almost as if making sure none disturb this tranquil scene.

The moment your [[weapon]] unsheathes, the tranquil silence shatters into a cacophony of roars. What was once a serene pond transforms into a battleground in an instant. In the midst of this chaos, you stand ready as the once placid haven turns into a spectacle of wild carnage.
[Combat]

children.choiceLabel: Fill a flask with the water

children.text: You approach the pond and take out an empty flask, letting the water sink into the glass.
The shimmering water appears to change hues several times, before settling on a single colour.

The moment your [[weapon]] unsheathes, the tranquil silence shatters into a cacophony of roars. What was once a serene pond transforms into a battleground in an instant. In the midst of this chaos, you stand ready as the once placid haven turns into a spectacle of wild carnage.
[Combat]
As you turn to leave, your gaze falls upon an imposing figure emerging from the shadows: a large, catlike creature, its sleek form gliding silently towards you, eyes fixed with feline curiosity.

The catlike creature moves with a serene grace, its lithe body gliding effortlessly through the environment as it makes its way towards the pond, its eyes gleaming with an understanding that this sanctuary would not be tainted by bloodshed today.

The moment your [[weapon]] unsheathes, the tranquil silence shatters into a cacophony of roars. What was once a serene pond transforms into a battleground in an instant. In the midst of this chaos, you stand ready as the once placid haven turns into a spectacle of wild carnage.

rootNode.text: As you turn a corner down a long hallway, you catch sight of a painting unlike any you've ever seen before. It's a landscape, but not one you recognize. Instead, it depicts a strange new land, with towering mountains and sprawling forests. With every step, the landscape seems to become more and more vivid - the colors becoming brighter, even sounds of chirping birds and the calming rustling of water fill the hallway.

children.text: Stepping closer still, you catch a soft breeze and look up to see branches of a great tree reach up to the ceiling, plump apples hanging from its branches.

You recognise the mysterious, idyllic land from ancient texts. As otherworldly as it looks now, the scene in front of you very much resembles how Aethos once was described. A garden planet, a paradise. As you watch both the bright sun and faded moon in orbit, still locked in their galactic dance, a sense of melancholy washes over you for a time you don't remember, then fades as quick as it came...

Intrigued, you reach out to touch the painting, and your hand passes through the canvas as if it were nothing more than air. Reaching inside the painting, your fingers seem to touch something solid just out of view.

Your fingers nimbly find a good place to latch onto the strange object, quickly pulling it back. A brief moment later, the magic of the painting seems to rapidly fade, returning it to its flat, two-dimensional depiction of the beautiful but unknown world.

Your fingers try to grasp on to the elusive object, feeling it just out of reach as the magic of the painting seems to rapidly fade. Just before the painting returns to its flat surface, you manage to pull your hand back to wipe off the trickle of sweat running down your temple.

As you pluck one of the apples from the painting, you feel a strange sensation in your hand. The apple feels real, solid and heavy. Suddenly, the apple disappears and you feel a rush of energy coursing through your body, filling you with the feeling of nourishment as if you'd just eaten the sweet fruit.

rootNode.text: Black and purple tapestries hang from tall, stone pillars surrounding a crystalline throne at the center of the grandiose room.

children.text: At the center of the room, a familiar black smoke coalesces once more and the demoness steps forth from the murky darkness. The succubus grins and clasps her hands together joyfully. "You finally made it! And you brought my puppet back to me!"
Viola watches the demon vanish, only averting her eyes once it has truly vanished. "Thank you for this opportunity, [[class]]. Not all are worthy of the lady's mercy. She will trouble us no longer."
effects: ADDTALENT: Blessing of the White Rose

children.text: "Ask and I shall answer, [[class]]."
"I am Viola Skysword, high priestess of the Order of the White Rose. I was summoned to guide the Dawnbringer in spiritual matters, as the prophecy foretold."

"The Dawnbringer is our champion of the light. The one who will free the Shattered Realms from darkness. Every few hundred years Rae sends us one of her children to aid our battle against the ever-encroaching darkness and push the demons back."

"We... I mean, I was part of the Dawnbringer's entourage. We were searching for a way into the Black Citadel when a demon and her minions attacked us." "And then the Dawnbringer just... left us! I couldn't believe my eyes as he walked away from the battle and disappeared into one of the tunnels."
"I don't know- after he left us he went into one of these tunnels. there must be something down there he needed very much. There was something in his eyes that... frightened me."
"Then may the White Rose watch over you, [[class]]. I am not sure if your mercy for this creature is misplaced, or you are further along the path than I am."

The priest nods and removes the Sun-shaped amulet before handing it to you. "Then the White Rose will aid you, hero. Use this amulet should you need aid in the journey ahead. I'll pray for you and see to it Rae looks kindly upon your quest."

In a small alcove above the room, a familiar black smoke coalesces once more until the demon steps forth from the murky mass of darkness. "You finally made it! Now the real fun can begin!" A rusty gate suddenly closes behind you, trapping you inside the room! Before you can react, the succubus claps her hands excitedly. "Now I get to see my puppets fight, fight, FIGHT! The priest nods and absentmindedly strides toward you.

children.choiceLabel: Reach for the crystal in your pocket

children.text: You touch the crystal, the strange whispers flooding your mind once more. The overtone of thoughts is those of bloodlust and gleeful pride, echoing the emotions of the succubus above.

children.choiceLabel: Focus on the thoughts of Bloodlust

children.text: You find the seed of demonic anger that fuels the bloodlust within the symphony of emotions resonating through the crystal. It feels almost tangible, malleable to the point where you can drown all other emotions out.
As you start to suppress all other emotions, you notice the demoness getting visibly more upset, finally leaping forward off the small balcony and into the arena. "Fine! I'll just finish you myself!"

Scowling, the demoness slinks back against one of the stone walls. Then her expression changes, the anger melting away like snow before the sun, replaced by a sultry glare. "So strong. So powerful." she gasps, slowly rising to her hooves. "Maybe I've misjudged you, not-a-puppet." she adds, steadying herself. "But you wouldn't hold that against me, would you, champion? I can be oh-so-useful once you get to know me..."

"Then may the White Rose watch over you, [[class]]. I am not sure if your mercy for this creature is misplaced, or you are further along the path than I am."

The priest nods and removes the Sun-shaped amulet before handing it to you. "Then the White Rose will aid you, hero. Use this amulet should you need aid in the journey ahead. I'll pray for you and see to it Rae looks kindly upon your quest."

The priest stands dazed for a moment as the demons influence visibly subsides. "Thank you for breaking me free, [[class]]. I am sure you have a lot of questions." From high above, a slow clapping bounces off the stone walls. "Very good! Very good! Again, go again!" the succubus' eyes begin to glow, and your vision starts to blur...
Viola watches the demon vanish, only averting her eyes once it has truly vanished. "Thank you for this opportunity, [[class]]. Not all are worthy of the lady's mercy. She will trouble us no longer."

rootNode.text: "HEY YOU WALKER - WANNA BUY SOMETHING?" a shrill voice shouts at you before an imp flutters into view, its tiny wings barely able to keep its potbellied frame in the air.

children.text: "MANY THINGS WALKER. MAAANY THINGS!" the imp nods and rummages through the large bag hanging from its left foot. "YOU LOOKING FOR ENCHANTMENTS? WE GOT LOTS!" The imp leans in conspiratorially, then continues to shout into your ear. "FOR YOU SPECIAL FRIEND GREAT PRICING. ONLY A LITTLE BIT OF SOUL. NOT WHOLE THING LIKE GREEDY DEMONSES." [The imp offers one of 4 random Enchantments to imbue at the cost of 20 maximum health. But be careful, once a deal is initiated you cant back out!]
The imp's smile widens even further than you thought possible before it quickly pushes the bag towards you with its hind legs. "GREATEST DECISION! LOOK! ONLY BEST FOR SMARTEST WALKER ON WHOLE WORLD."
The imp's smile widens even further than you thought possible before it quickly pushes the bag towards you with its hind legs. "GREATEST DECISION! LOOK! ONLY BEST FOR SMARTEST WALKER ON WHOLE WORLD."

rootNode.text: The priestess of The Gilded Rose bows, hands folded inside the extravagant robes. "Do you seek the Light's guidance, [[class]]?"

children.choiceLabel: 50 gold: Reduce my Maximum Health Penalty
Pray: Heal my wounds, Lady of Mercy

children.text: The White Rose bestows her Blessing, [[class]].

rootNode.text: You make your way deeper into the woods and stumble upon a bush spotted with large, plump purple berries.

children.text: You recognize the berries from your studies and recall a way to distill their essence into a potent potion.
The overwhelming sensation of sweetness seems to somehow sharpen your mind and allows you to remove an unwanted card from your deck.

rootNode.text: You spot a bushel of extraordinarily large mushrooms growing between gnarly roots of a giant tree.

children.text: You recognize the mushrooms as highly poisonous. If you want, you could turn them into a potent weapon.

children.choiceLabel: Coat one of your weapons in the poison

children.text:
As soon as you take the first bite, you recognize your mistake as a nauseating feeling washes over you...

You've been Poisoned

rootNode.text: [?!questflag:quit][continue]"Ah, finally - some shadow. Such a strange thing to be longing for in these times of darkness. We will set up camp and make repairs." [?questflag:quit][continue]"You find a brief moment in the shadow, allowing you to gather your thoughts before moving on."

children.choiceLabel: Rest and don't repair the wagon

rootNode.text: The buffet is a feast for the senses. Golden trays overflow with succulent roasted meats, jewel-toned fruits, and fragrant spices. Aromas of exotic dishes fill the air, and colourful cocktails bubble in crystal goblets.

children.text: The musician nods. "Certainly, any special requests?"
The Mazurka is a revigorating tune, removing an affliction every other turn. Would you like me to play it now?
The musician nods. "Certainly, any special requests?"
The Viennese is a fast phased dance, with strong swings of tempo, inflicting Haste and Slow every other turn. Would you like me to play it now?
The musician nods. "Certainly, any special requests?"

The Waltz is the most popular of ballroom dances and bound to get a rise out of even the most reserved crowd. The intensity of the Waltz increases the Anger of both combatants every other turn. Would you like me to play it now?
The musician nods. "Certainly, any special requests?"

children.choiceLabel: Remove a card: Drink the wine

children.text: The deep red wine warms the blood and dulls the senses, making it easier for past experiences to slip from your mind.
The roasted meats are succulent and tender, the fruits burst with juicy flavour, and the exotic dishes are a harmony of fragrant spices, leaving you refreshed for the challenges ahead.

rootNode.text: A banner marked with a bloody paw waves in the wind, ashes fluttering past the torn red cloth.

children.text: Battle Momentum has been lowered by 2!

rootNode.text: A crude formation of bones and scattered blood decorates the ground.

children.text: Whatever these markings are, they are no good. Time to put an end to whatever these druids are planning.

With a swift kick, you disturb the bones. For a moment, the surrounding area goes quiet before a soft, rumbling tremble starts to shake the ground. A loud roar sends a flock of birds flying from their nests, the sound reverberating in the back of your mind. "FREEEEEEE MEEEEE-..."

These bones, the blood - these druids seem to be performing a ritual of sorts. These symbols and sacrifices appear to have some connection to Selandris. Surely, whatever these druids were up to - no good can come of this...

With a swift kick, you disturb the bones. For a moment, the surrounding area goes quiet before a soft, rumbling tremble starts to shake the ground. A loud roar sends a flock of birds flying from their nests, the sound reverberating in the back of your mind. "FREEEEEEE MEEEEE-..."

The Circles of binding, the ritual - its all reminiscent of the summoning rituals you learned about as a child, but on a much grander scale. To bring back the Dead Star would require a tremendous amount of energy from whatever was bound by these circles.

With a swift kick, you disturb the bones. For a moment, the surrounding area goes quiet before a soft, rumbling tremble starts to shake the ground. A loud roar sends a flock of birds flying from their nests, the sound reverberating in the back of your mind. "FREEEEEEE MEEEEE-..."

rootNode.text: Amongst the thralls stands a woman dressed in gold and white robes. Her outfit matches the description of those who were with the Dawnbringer.

children.text: The vacant expression in her eyes is no different than those of the thralls around her. Clearly, this priest has fallen under some sort of spell...
A sudden laughter fills the mines. "Oh! You like this puppet, don't you? Well you can't have it, it is MINE!"

The laughter fades into a chuckle as black smoke fills the area before the demon appears next to the robed human and runs a sharp-nailed finger over the enthralled priestess' cheek. "Why not? Let's have some fun before you become part of my collection too."

"BORING!" the demoness screeches, lashing out with her tail. "Just as boring as the last puppet that came trudging through our little home. At least he left some of his playthings behind." the demoness smiles, running a pointed finger down the priestess' cheek.
The demon nods and spins around, looking back at the stone hallways of the Ember Mines with a dramatic sigh. "I used to have such a beautiful home here, when suddenly... -BOOM-!"
"Who? I don't know his name. He didn't seem in the mood for talking with his hair on fire and slashing into my puppets left and right." The demoness pouts. "I lost a lot of good puppets that day."

children.choiceLabel: Perhaps we can make a deal

children.text: The succubus blinks. "A... trade?" she smiles and taps her chin with a pointy nail. "What can you offer me, puppet?"

The demoness smiles. "How many? Wait- don't tell me - don't spoil it! It must be many- many new puppets for just this one?" She looks at the priest, suddenly disinterested in the holy woman, then looks at the entrance of the strange cavern.
The demon loses her composure as her eyes flare up. "Such a BORING puppet!" With a huff of black and purple smoke the demon disappears, along with the echoing sounds of her laughter.

children.choiceLabel: Take the bandits, they are just outside.

children.text: "Aren't you just full of surprises! Take this puppet- I was done with it anyways!" With a snap of her fingers, the succubus releases the priest from her spell, then dashes off towards the entrance of the cavern, leaving dark, purple smoke and a strong scent of sulfur in her wake. ... "What... what happened?"
The demon loses her composure as her eyes flare up. "Such a BORING puppet!" With a huff of black and purple smoke the demon disappears, along with the echoing sounds of her laughter.

With a snap of her fingers, the succubus releases the priest from her spell, then dashes off towards the entrance of the cavern, leaving dark, purple smoke and a strong scent of sulfur in her wake. ... "What... what happened?"
The demon loses her composure as her eyes flare up. "Such a BORING puppet!" With a huff of black and purple smoke the demon disappears, along with the echoing sounds of her laughter.
The demon loses her composure as her eyes flare up. "Such a BORING puppet!" With a huff of black and purple smoke the demon disappears, along with the echoing sounds of her laughter.
The demon loses her composure as her eyes flare up. "Such a BORING puppet!" With a huff of black and purple smoke the demon disappears, along with the echoing sounds of her laughter.
The demon raises her finger and waggles it playfully. "Oh, now why would I do that? I worked so hard to rebuild my collection after that boorish oaf destroyed my little domain."
The demon nods and spins around, looking back at the stone hallways of the Ember Mines with a dramatic sigh. "I used to have such a beautiful home here, when suddenly... -BOOM-!"
"Who? I don't know his name. He didn't seem in the mood for talking with his hair on fire and slashing into my puppets left and right." The demoness pouts. "I lost a lot of good puppets that day."

children.choiceLabel: Perhaps we can make a deal

children.text: The succubus blinks. "A... trade?" she smiles and taps her chin with a pointy nail. "What can you offer me, puppet?"

The demoness smiles. "How many? Wait- don't tell me - don't spoil it! It must be many- many new puppets for just this one?" She looks at the priest, suddenly disinterested in the holy woman, then looks at the entrance of the strange cavern.

rootNode.text: A fanged statue grins at you ominously from underneath its dark hood, stone hand extended towards you, a granite goblet in the other.

children.text: Sanguine Shrines convert the energy cost of a single card to Blood Energy, allowing you to spend health instead of energy to play it at the cost of 10 Maximum Health.

children.choiceLabel: 10 Maximum Health: Drip blood in the cup

children.text: The statues' goblet slowly fills with blood as its stony fingers produce a bloodstained card, its fanged mouth curving into a satisfied smile...

rootNode.text: A handsome, roguish figure stands before you, its stone surface remarkably untouched by its harsh environment, and its gloved hand extended towards you, ready to accept yours.

children.text: The statue seems to look up longingly from its flourishing, frozen bow, its one hand extended towards you, the other hiding a dagger behind its back.

children.choiceLabel: Place your hand in its hand

children.text: As you place your hand in the statue's, its other hand suddenly snaps forward and presses a stone dagger on top of it. Though the dagger is blunt, unable to puncture your skin, a stinging pain suddenly pierces your mind. "Forgive me, my love." The words seem to flow through your thoughts, weaving through your own until both the voice and the pain fade.

children.choiceLabel: Place a card in its hand

children.text: The statue seems to nod conspiratorially, before it returns the marked card. Then it resumes its static pose and vacant expression once more.

rootNode.text: Stone tendrils twist and coil around the shapeless stone of a deep black rock. Whatever this statue was meant to represent, its meaning seems long lost - if it ever had one to begin with.

children.text: Predictably, the outcomes of the Shrine of Chaos are quite unpredictable. Use at your own peril.

The stone tendrils lash out at the cards, frantically rearranging them as they twist swirl around the base of the smooth black stone, finally settling into a spider like figure that hands back each card almost reverantly before they return to their formless mass.

rootNode.text: A carving sculpted from marble of the purest white captures your attention. Its luminescent surface exudes a sense of boundless abundance. A strangely thorned hand gracefully extends, inviting you to accept its offers.

children.text: The shrine allows you to transform a card into a different card of the same color and same rarity.
The statue accepts your hand and offering in its thorned hand. The confident smile appears to fade into a smirk that seems to recognize your reservations before it offers you a brand new card.

The statue accepts your hand and offering in its thorned hand, its confident smile never waning as you feel the thorns press through the card and into your flesh. After a angonizing moment, the stone hand releases it now bloodied grip, revealing a brand new card!

rootNode.text: The angelic features of the stone statue tower out from its pristine pedestal. Above its brilliantly carved head, both hands reach for the darkened skies, its fingers forming a perfect triangle while colorful lights dance over its marbled features.

children.text: The colorful lights sliding over the statue's white-stone carvings seem to originate from the very top of the shrine.

You shield your eyes from the bright lights to try and find the source of the magical display, but fail to see anything that would conjure the hypnotic patterns of lights. The angelic features of the stone statue tower out from its pristine pedestal. Above its brilliantly carved head, both hands reach for the darkened skies, its fingers forming a perfect triangle while colorful lights dance over its marbled features.

children.choiceLabel: Infuse the energy of a card

children.text: You offer the statue a card and the dancing lights pause - then each beam centers on your hand, quickly merging into a blinding white beam. After a brief moment, the lights resume their lively dance, having turned the cards natural energy into a humming power.

children.choiceLabel: Swap the energy cost of 2 cards

children.text: As soon as you offer the statue the second card, the dancing lights seem to pause - then center their position on the first card, then the second, quickly merging into a blinding white beam. After a brief moment, the lights resume their lively dance, revealing the newly forged cards.

rootNode.text: The stone face of an old sailor stares out into the starry night. At its feet, a plaque reads "Hope Anchors the Soul"

children.text: The shrine adds Memorized to a card. Cards with this property get shuffled to the top of your deck at the start of combat.

The shrine seems to smile as the image of a young sailor appears in your mind, standing tall at the wheel of a fast moving ship. For a moment, you feel the breeze in your hair, before the image fades, leaving a memory as vivid as if you had been the boy at the helm of that ship yourself...

rootNode.text: A strange statue stares at you longingly, surrounded by various objects that share an exact counterpart amidst the rubble.

children.text: The statue takes the coin before handing you back a perfect replica of the gold object.

rootNode.text: The statue of a twisted figure stands out from its surroundings. Out of its many contorted limbs, two open hands stretch out towards you...

children.text: The statue of a twisted figure stands out from its surroundings. Out of its many contorted limbs, two open hands stretch out towards you... Bolgar spits at the statue's feet. "This one is best ignored, [[class]]. Nothing good will come of dealing with this... creature and its ilk."

Unless my memory betrays me, this particular one is known as Serem-Pek. A miserable creature, worshipped by its equally pitiful kind. They have no place in this new world, but it appears someone is reluctant to let go of the past.

They have no name in your tongue, [[class]], but a name that fits is Scavengers. Precursors to suffering wherever they may find it. Now, let us be done with this place, and leave what should be left alone.
The statue seems to briefly come to life as dust slides off its stone limbs, wrapping its contorted fingers around the card until it re-emerges anew in front of you.
Bolgar narrows his eyes and seems to pay more attention to the surrounding area before putting one foot in front of the other and falling into step.

rootNode.text: The statue of a stately figure looms over you, its left-hand open, the right wielding a large gavel inscribed with the words "Power through sacrifice".

children.text: Select a card to remove, then upgrade all cards sharing the card's type by 1. (types are Melee, Magic, Ranged, Divine).
The gavel glows brightly as it strikes the card you placed in its extended hand. Your mind fills with pride for one brief moment, and the statue seems to stand even taller than before.

rootNode.text: A flame flickers brightly in front of a broken down statue, casting deep shadows of the outstretched hand of the robed figure.

children.text: This Shrine of Power allows you to sacrifice a card to upgrade a random card a number of times depending on the sacrificed card's rarity. (Upgraded cards deal more damage.)
The flame flickers brightly as it suddenly changes color. The orange tones are replaced by a bright green hue, which lights up the area before returning to its original shade.

rootNode.text: You spot a worn statue at the wayside. Even though its base is shattered, it seems firmly grounded in the dirt. Upon inspection, its folded hands seem to have a small space between them, perhaps intended to slot in a card.

children.text: Shrine of Stability adds 'Reliable' to a card. Cards with Reliable ignore their Ambush, Bloodlust, Cascade, Continuity, Finale, Flanking, Flow and Frenzy conditions.
You place the card in between the shrines hands, pressed together in front of its chest. For a while, nothing happens until finally, the hands slide apart, allowing the card to slip free.

rootNode.text: A strange statue stands alone in an otherwise deserted area. It's difficult to determine the number of figures are depicted in the blackened shrine, as faces seem to constantly shift, almost as if they mocking those who try to find shape in their chaos.

children.text: The shrine allows you to alter a card unpredictably. Some students of chaos might even be able to harness the conflux in interesting ways.

The statue swirls around the card as it too becomes consumed in its chaotic shapes Before you know it, you feel it center around a single card, sweeping it along before it returns to you, visibly marked by the experience.

You try to focus on the shifting shapes, trying to discern a clear pattern. After a brief moment, both the shrine and card return to their original form, and you feel the infused power tingling the tips of your fingers.

You feel the chaos call out to you and you are able to answer back. Before you know it, you feel it center around a single card, sweeping it along before it returns to you, visibly marked by the experience.

children.text: Shrine of Balance allows you to swap the upgrades between two cards or to upgrade one card.

rootNode.text: "At least, I did it... MINE way..." The large molekin swirls on his feet and drops to the ground, dustplumes rising where his heavy body now rests.

children.text: "Good work, guardian." the merchant hesitantly offers from his spot behind the caravan. "It appears Brightcandle is just over yonder, which means the terms of your contract with the Emporium have been fulfilled."

rootNode.text: The statue of Sungod Rae towers before you, its features sculpted with divine grace. The angel's wings are spread wide, and its face is set in a serene, yet distant expression. Despite the reverence surrounding its form, the stone from which it is carved feels unnaturally cold and distant.

children.text: You circle the statue, taking in the minute details of its craftsmanship. The angel is adorned with symbols of light and purity, its stance majestic and imposing - yet its gaze seems distant, almost apathetic to its surroundings.

As your fingers graze the stone, you expect to feel a divine warmth, but it's just cold, hard marble. The disconnect between the statue's exalted image and its lifeless touch is unsettling. The statue of Sungod Rae towers before you, its features sculpted with divine grace. The angel's wings are spread wide, and its face is set in a serene, yet distant expression. Despite the reverence surrounding its form, the stone from which it is carved feels unnaturally cold and distant.

At the base of the statue, you find an inscription: "In the light of Rae, all shadows disperse, and all souls find guidance." The words are meant to inspire, but the air around the statue remains chillingly silent.

children.choiceLabel: Reflect on the nature of Rae.

children.text: It is obvious the statue before you represents a being of great power, yet the cold stones inability to retain the warmth portrayed by the various symbols appears to mock the very ideals it's meant to embody. The statue of Sungod Rae towers before you, its features sculpted with divine grace. The angel's wings are spread wide, and its face is set in a serene, yet distant expression. Despite the reverence surrounding its form, the stone from which it is carved feels unnaturally cold and distant.

At the base of the statue, you find an inscription: "In the light of Rae, all shadows disperse, and all souls find guidance." The words are meant to inspire, but the air around the statue remains chillingly silent.

children.choiceLabel: Reflect on the nature of Rae.

children.text: It is obvious the statue before you represents a being of great power, yet the cold stones inability to retain the warmth portrayed by the various symbols appears to mock the very ideals it's meant to embody. The statue of Sungod Rae towers before you, its features sculpted with divine grace. The angel's wings are spread wide, and its face is set in a serene, yet distant expression. Despite the reverence surrounding its form, the stone from which it is carved feels unnaturally cold and distant.

You circle the statue, taking in the minute details of its craftsmanship. The angel is adorned with symbols of light and purity, its stance majestic and imposing - yet its gaze seems distant, almost apathetic to its surroundings.

As your fingers graze the stone, you expect to feel a divine warmth, but it's just cold, hard marble. The disconnect between the statue's exalted image and its lifeless touch is unsettling. rootNode.text: You take a moment to survey the chaos of the battlefield. Demons charge into makeshift walls of shields and blades, the fortifications barely withstanding the onslaught. Smoke and dust rise from the ground as explosions paint deep craters in the bloodied soil.

children.choiceLabel: Try to see how the Crusaders are holding up

children.text: Amid the clashing weapons and shouts of soldiers, you notice neither side seems to be making progress. Suddenly, a thundering voice booms over the battlefield, quickly followed by a series of loud explosions that indiscriminately impacts demons and Crusaders alike.

children.choiceLabel: Look for the source of the Bombardment

children.text: The smoke stings your eyes, compromising your vision, but you are still able to discern a towering figure behind the barricades, bellowing commands to his demonic horde. Despite the chaos of battle, you sense this imposing demon is responsible for the devastating blasts that have ripped through the battlefield with impunity.
The force of the explosions has uncovered large swaths of muddy soil, revealing a gruesome landscape of twisted steel, shattered armor, and the skewered corpses of both humans and demons.
The battlefield is chaotic, with the sounds of clashing weapons and shouts of soldiers filling the air.

You join the contingent of crusaders engaged in a valiant fight. Shoulder to shoulder, you manage to drive back wave after wave of demons while Reghar and a few others repair the fortifications. After what feels like an eternity, the improvised palisades stand once more. A knight in golden armor salutes you, his face grim but grateful. Battle Momentum has been reduced to 0! Reghar nods, adding a final piece to the sturdy looking fortification. "T'is good t' see you still know what really matters, [[class]]. T'is acts like yours that separate us from these beasts."

children.choiceLabel: Look for anything usable amongst the rubble.

children.text:
In the distance, you can hear the Crusaders struggle to fend off the demons. Battle Momentum has been increased by 1!

Looking around, you spot something glimmering in the blood-stained soil. I am pleasantly surprised you have your priorities straight, [[class]]. If these soldiers were half as resourceful as you perhaps they would have fared better.

rootNode.text: You scan the crowd, spotting all sorts of wild costumes. Amongst the vibrant colours, one guest stands quiet, dressed in yellows and wearing a golden mask.

children.choiceLabel: Approach the guest with the golden mask

children.text: As you approach the guest in yellow, a sudden glimpse catches your eye...

The mysterious guest stumbles back, clearly taken aback by your display of strength, her mask displaced from the sudden motion. "You are going to be fun..." she smirks, then leaps up to one of the balconies.
You run up the balcony, but by the time you get there the mysterious woman is nowhere to be seen.
You find 25 Gold!
You find 25 Gold!

...and you quickly grab the wrist holding a silver dagger before it plunges into your thigh. The figure in black briefly seems just as surprised as you are, then pushes you off before disappearing into the crowd without a trace.

children.choiceLabel: Upgrade a Basic attack: Take the dagger.
Heal 5: Just patch up the wound.

children.text: ...before a sharp sting suddenly erupts from your side. You look down to see a slim, silver dagger stuck in your thigh, with a note attached. "Stay out of this, stranger.". As you look back up, the guest in black is nowhere to be found.

Your eyes lock with those of the mysterious guest with the golden mask - bright honey-coloured embers peering back at you calmly before the figure turns and makes their way to one of the many hallways.
As the figure moves, its cloak briefly reveals a familiar mark - the mark of the Emporium. While you contemplate the implications, the figure seems to blend with the crowd and you lose track.
The figure starts to move, slipping behind one of the pillars, only to never emerge on the other side...
Your trained instincts make you well aware of the cloaked figure without even a single glance in their direction.

You find a nice corner to observe the guest with the golden mask. Despite no obvious markings, the black silk of their outfit outlined the distinct shapes of an armour only worn by the Emporium's inner circle.

You approach with a predators guile, grabbing the guests cloak before it was aware of your presence. For a moment, you see the surprise in the eyes behind the mask... ...before the figure suddenly leaps from your grasp up onto one of the balconies, its slender lips curving into a respectful smile. "Not bad!" then flicks you a thick golden coin for your trouble.

rootNode.text: A soft squealing breaks the unnatural silence within these woods. "Nggghh...!! NGGGGHHHH!" As you circle the suspiciously noisy tree, the noises get louder and louder until you see the bound man squirming against the ropes wrapped around his entire torso - a torso stripped down to its boots and undergarments.

children.text: As you slide the man's boots off, a few well-hidden coins tumble out onto the dirt! You find 15 Gold!
The squealing gets louder and louder as soon as it dawns on the man you are about to leave him in the middle of the bandit-infested woods.

The merchant brushes off his coat indignantly and seems confused about the whole ordeal. Finally, he glances at his discarded boots on the ground and narrows his eyes. "We will consider that a small fee for freeing us from this ordeal." "Now, unless you intend to rob us of our britches as well, we have matters we need to attend to back in Brightcandle."

children.choiceLabel: Actually, now that you mention it...

children.text: The merchant stares at you indignantly, his plump face turning almost beet red before he suddenly turns and starts running back down the mossy trail towards Brightcandle.
The squealing gets louder and louder as soon as it dawns on the man you are about to leave him in the middle of the bandit-infested woods.

As soon as the man is free he huffs indignantly and picks up the feathered hat at his feet. "We thank you kindly, stranger. It appears we were... hasty in our decision to take our business to these scoundrels." "It will turn out to be their loss. Which is good news for you, friend. As a token of our gratitude, we'll make our services available to you. At a considerable discount, of course."
"Why, cards of course. Only the best ones, we might add. Care to have a look?"

children.choiceLabel: Where do you get all these cards?

children.text: "Our connections with the Emporium make sure potential profit doesn't slip past them in even the most dangerous of places." "Along with the cards adventurers trade us, or find they have no use for anymore, or for... other reasons. Mainly because they are-... dead." Noticing his words have soured the mood somewhat, the merchant quickly smiles. "But we assure you, should such an ill fate befall you, your own collection will be sold at a considerable margin. No discounts on the cards touched by the hero who saved Julius Bellthorp!"

rootNode.text: A macabre tableau unfolds before you, bones of demons and crusaders intertwined in a gruesome dance. The air thick with the stench of death, a haunting reminder of the fierce battle that once raged here.

children.choiceLabel: Delve a Basic Attack: Pick up a weapon

children.text: "Those were good weapons. Glad to see me old master did not lose his touch, even though it did not do these folks any good..."

Bolgar looks around and steadies himself on his crooked staff. "Look around, hero. This is the signature of Serem-Pek. Destruction, death, and above all, misery. It feeds on it, helplessly trying to sate it's ever growing appetite."

"The power in this place is... palpable. We could learn a thing or two from this if we want to rid ourselves of these demons once and for all." "It wasn't just the demons it slaughtered. It makes no distinction between good and evil - which makes it even more dangerous." Theresa smiles wryly. "And practical. A creature after my own heart."
"A parasite, one of the worst of its kind. It feeds indiscriminately on whatever it can find."
"How does anyone get anywhere, [[class]]? It travelled here. Across time, and space - it will go wherever it can to feed its hunger."
"If I were to wager a guess - the fall of the Goliath would have attracted the attention of it. A demi-god suffering in its final moments would be able to sustain it for aeons."

children.choiceLabel: How do you know all this?

children.text: "There aren't many things as old as I am, but I am sure Serem-Pek exceeds even my considerable lifespan. And when you've been around as long as we have, you are bound to run into each other."

children.choiceLabel: How do you know all this?

children.text: "There aren't many things as old as I am, but I am sure Serem-Pek exceeds even my considerable lifespan. And when you've been around as long as we have, you are bound to run into each other."

Bolgar looks around and steadies himself on his crooked staff. "Look around, hero. This is the signature of Serem-Pek. Destruction, death, and above all, misery. It feeds on it, helplessly trying to sate it's ever growing appetite."

"The power in this place is... palpable. We could learn a thing or two from this if we want to rid ourselves of these demons once and for all." "It wasn't just the demons it slaughtered. rootNode.text: A log cabin rises into view through the undergrowth. The bark-covered logs chinked with sand and mortar. A stone chimney rises from the far side of the thatched roof as vines and weeds cling to the walls. Perhaps you might find some valuables or enjoy sleeping in a bed, beneath a proper roof?

children.text: Inside the cabin, cold ashes rest in a stone fireplace. A wood and rope bed fills the far wall, and dust blows across the wooden floorboards.

Starting a fire, you manage to find several ingredients. A pot of honey, mustard, and dried herbs - all you needed to make a true feast out of whatever you had on hand already. As the smells of a well-cooked meal start to fill the cabin, the sensation of being watched intensifies.
You call out but get no response. Yet the feeling of being watched does not diminish.
Something about the cabin's aura reminds you of tales of guardian spirits. With a smile, you prepare an extra serving - traditionally left for the spirits' safekeeping during the night.

After enjoying the meal you fall into a peaceful slumber and awake refreshed the next day. In the morning, you find a small bag of coins placed beside your bedding, and the plate you left on the stove empty.
As you leave, the faint sounds of grateful laughter fill your ears.

As you leave, the faint sounds of grateful laughter fill your ears.
Ransacking the cabin, you find nothing of use or value. You cannot shake the feeling that something is watching you in disapproval. Perhaps this isn't a safe place to stay the night after all...
Your tinder refuses to take, a most unusual occurrence, so you are left to snack on cold bread and honey.
In the middle of the night the bed collapses, jolting you awake from your slumber!
As you leave, you hear the faint sounds of bemused giggles though you can't see from whom.

rootNode.text: Three cloaked figures around a warmly bristling campfire seem to be engaged in a cardgame of some kind.

children.text: You quietly steal some of the food, leaving the three figures to play out their morbid game in peace.

One of the figures spots you and points a bony finger in your direction. "A visitor." its ghostly voice whispers. The other two figures turn their heads, revealing their skeletal faces. "Ah, think it wants to play a game?" the second adds to the first, its grin widening as the third makes some space around the fire.
Three cards get dealt in front of you. The dealers dark eye-sockets light up as it extends a bony finger toward the cards. "Pick your fate, stranger..."
The skeleton folds its hands and grins widely, its two companions mirroring the action. "Fate seems impatient with you, stranger.
The skeleton nods as it reveals the card, then smiles. "Action begets action - Fortune sees you are ready, stranger."

The skeletal figure can barely contain its excitement, long yellow teeth clattering in its skull. As it lifts the card, skies darken above. "Foolishness or bravery, it matters not, you have earned our respect, stranger."

"Ah, but we insist, " the third skeletal figure croons with a cackle. A sudden force pulls you towards the fire, while the figureshuffles a glowing deck of cards.Three cards get dealt in front of you. rootNode.text: "So you must be the stranger roaming my lands my hunters have told me about. Good- good! I was getting bored!"

children.text: "Maki?" the old man narrows his bloodshot eyes, two large axes dragging down the snowy trail behind him. The huntress looks both horrified and determined at the sight of the old Chieftain. "It's too late, father. There is no forgiveness for-" "Enough! You shouldnt have come back- girl." The chieftain pauses for a moment, lifting one of his axes in your direction. "But now I see... Youve come bearing gifts!" "Our new allies have been whispering about a certain [[class]]. Perhaps you arent the useless pup I thought you were. Now let's bring this 'happy reunion' to its inevitable conclusion."
[Combat]

"...Hildune?! What game are you playing? You- you were dead! And why do you stand with this outlander?" "So easily confused you are, Gorn. A few whispers in the wind and you bark like the lapdog you are. It is time we had some... fresh blood lead us, don't you agree?" "I am the chosen one! I will enjoy every moment as I tear your 'champion' apart, Hildune. Then I will come for you!"
[Combat]
[Combat]

rootNode.text: An intense unpleasant odor suddenly reaches your nostrils. It seems to originate from a big pulsing cocoon the size of a person.

children.text: The stench multiplies as a viscous liquid starts spilling out, accompanied by a thick green gas that blinds you for a moment. Rot is increased by 20. After the gas clears, you can see the rest of the cocoon is filled with equally repulsive contents, though you do find something shining in the back.
The cocoon itself feels warm, but you start to feel cold... After you quickly pull your hand away, it feels like it drained something from you. Rot is decreased by 50.

rootNode.text: "Hello hello! Lucky day for you, mortal friend!" An imp rushes after you, then bows with exaggerated flourish, revealing a collection of brightly coloured bottles attached to its belt. "Zixis finest merchant of the Legions!" He taps his belt, grinning to reveal rows of needle-like teeth. "Blood of a greater demons! Makes you fierce! Only costs a little piece of yourself. Nothing you'll miss, promise promise!"

children.choiceLabel: What do you mean, a piece of myself?

children.text: The imp giggles, rubbing its clawed hands together. "Just little memories! Happy ones you don't need. You won't notice!"

It produces a small crystal and holds it up. "Just thing Zixis collects! Think of happy day. Childhood joy, perhaps? First love? Victory in battle? Yes, yes, that one!" The imp leans in, gently shaking one of the swirling bottles. "Then, you forgets ALL about that, and become new, BETTER persons! Easy like that!"

children.choiceLabel: Fine, make me forget who I am

children.text: The imp nods gleefully. "Close eyes now!" it demands as it presses the crystal to your head. The crystal feels hot to the touch, draining your very essence. "Ohh, goods memories! And bads. Very sads." the imp nods solemnly then plucks a trio of potions from its belt. "Now you pick, who you wants to be!"
"Ohh, wants to be strong!" The imp flexes their tiny arms. "Now you pick one more, what you wants to be!"
You feel the emptiness subside, new thoughts of a different life flooding your mind. "You now a mighty [[class]], hero! Thank you for business!".
You feel the emptiness subside, new thoughts of a different life flooding your mind. "You now a mighty [[class]], hero! Thank you for business!".
"Ohh, wants to be smarts like Zixis!" The imp nods and picks at his nose. "Now you pick one more, what you wants to be!"
You feel the emptiness subside, new thoughts of a different life flooding your mind. "You now a mighty [[class]], hero! Thank you for business!".
You feel the emptiness subside, new thoughts of a different life flooding your mind. "You now a mighty [[class]], hero! Thank you for business!".
"Ohh, wants to be fast!" The imp quickly flies in a circle around you before presenting you with 3 more bottles. "Now you pick one more, what you wants to be!"
You feel the emptiness subside, new thoughts of a different life flooding your mind. "You now a mighty [[class]], hero! Thank you for business!".

children.choiceLabel: No deal, I like who I am

children.text: The imp's friendly demeanor shifts instantly. "Foolish mortal! Spurning gifts of Legion! Many would kill for Zixis' potions!" "Remember this moment when Abyssal armies march across your lands! Remember Zixis offered you power!" The imp spits on the ground, then spreads its wings and flies away, muttering curses under its breath.

Remember Zixis offered you power!" The imp spits on the ground, then spreads its wings and flies away, muttering curses under its breath.

With lightning reflexes, you lunge forward and seize the imp by its scrawny throat. It squeals and writhes in your grip. "No fair! No fair! Zixis just making business!" The imp struggles futilely against your grasp.

children.choiceLabel: (Tighten your grip) Tell me what you know!

children.text: "Put down! Put down! Zixis will tell!" "Big Lord here because he hides! He scared of others. HA HA! Scared big demon. Zixis not scared, Zixis smart and makes trades." "Please let go now? Zixis told truth!" The imp slips from your grasp, immediately scuttles backwhile rubbing its throat. "Zixis remembers this! Legion remembers this!" With a final hiss, the imp unfurls its wings and flies away, disappearing into the distance.

children.choiceLabel: Take a bottle by force and drink it

children.text: You snatch the bottle from the imp's belt. It grins, not attempting to stop you. "Yes, yes! Drink now! Become strong!" Before you can respond, you feel the bottle grow warm in your hand. Too late, you notice a faint rune etched into the glass that begins to glow. Then the bottle shatters, releasing a cloud of noxious smoke. You take 6 damage! "Silly mortal! Touch Zixis's things without paying! Now you pay with pain!" The imp dances mockingly before unfurling its wings and flying off.

You raise your holy symbol, which begins to glow with divine light. The imp shrieks and covers its eyes. "Cheating! Cheating! No fair using that! Zixis will remember your face! Tell masters about you! Abyssal Legion knows your scent now!" With a final shriek, the imp vanishes in a puff of sulfurous smoke. The bottles drops to the ground, their contents evaporating instantly upon contact with the earth in a dark cloud of smoke.

You turn and walk away, ignoring the imp's offers. "Wait! Wait! Don't go! Good deals here!" The imp calls after you, its voice growing more desperate. "Fine! Zixis find someone else! Many mortals want power! Not special, you!"

rootNode.text: As the twisted pirate-demon falls, a familiar clattering of whispers fills the damp cavern. After a moment, the voices coalesce into a single, booming voice once more. "So this is where the maggot was hiding. Well done [[class]], you've done us a grand favor."

children.text: "A greedy nuisance, stealing things that belong to us..." the voices break apart once more. "To us! Us! Belong to us!" Finally, the words settle down into a discernible pattern again. "Both our worlds are better off without their cursed existence if that eases your conscience, [[class]]."

children.choiceLabel: I need to get to the Cathedral

children.text: "Ah yes - our part of our little bargain. You have not disappointed, [[class]]. And perhaps... you will surprise us yet." Suddenly a flash of light fills the cavern. As your eyes readjust, you see a trail of lights leading down the narrow trenches of the underground ruins. "Go now, with our Blessing, Lumian." The Voices whisper, once more returning to the chaotic cacophony before disappearing into the darkness of The Deep.

rootNode.text: You close your eyes for a moment's rest, but sleep brings no peace. In your dream, you stand at the edge of a vast, dark ocean under alien stars. The constellations form patterns that seem almost readable  a cosmic language just beyond comprehension.

children.text: You tilt your head upward, studying the unfamiliar stars. Their configuration shifts subtly as you watch, forming symbols that your mind struggles to interpret.

children.choiceLabel: Attempt to decipher the stellar pattern

children.text: Your trained mind begins to grasp the cosmic language written in starlight. Understanding floods in  knowledge of your insignificance in an infinite, uncaring universe. You awake with a cold sweat soaking your clothes. The dream fades quickly, but leaves you wondering just what lurks at the edges of our understanding of the world...

You avert your gaze, but the stellar patterns have already burned themselves into your mind. Maybe they'll return in future dreams, waiting to reveal their secrets... You awake with a cold sweat soaking your clothes. The dream fades quickly, but leaves you wondering just what lurks at the edges of our understanding of the world...
You peer into the dark waters, where something vast shifts beneath the surface. For a moment, a single enormous eye rises to meet your gaze  ancient, knowing, and utterly alien.

You face the ancient presence without flinching, drawing upon inner strength. The eye studies you with what might be respect before slowly sinking back into the abyss. You awake with a cold sweat soaking your clothes. The dream fades quickly, but leaves you wondering just what lurks at the edges of our understanding of the world...

You cannot look away as the eye holds your gaze. In its pupil, you see civilizations rise and fall, stars born and dying, all watched with the same impassive attention now fixed upon you. You awake with a cold sweat soaking your clothes. The dream fades quickly, but leaves you wondering just what lurks at the edges of our understanding of the world...

You call out across the dark waters. Your voice seems impossibly small, yet the vast presence beneath the surface stirs in response. The water ripples as something enormous moves closer to the surface.

children.choiceLabel: Ask who or what it is

children.text: The water before you parts, revealing something rising from the depths. Its form defies comprehension  angles that shouldn't exist, dimensions that hurt to perceive. The form seems to engulf you, until nothing but the vast, formless darkness remains. Reality washed away in one, mesmerizing swoop - like it never was, and never would be again. You awake with a cold sweat soaking your clothes. The dream fades quickly, but leaves you wondering just what lurks at the edges of our understanding of the world...

children.choiceLabel: Step back from the water's edge

children.text: With nimble reflexes, you retreat from the shore as something massive breaks the surface. Distance grants clarity; you glimpse only the smallest portion of an entity too vast to comprehend. You reach out to it, dimensions losing all meaning as your hand now seems to engulf the entity that moments before appeared to engulf you. It withers, leaving something tangible between your blackened fingers. You awake with a cold sweat soaking your clothes. The dream fades quickly, but leaves you wondering just what lurks at the edges of our understanding of the world...

Through sheer force of will, you tear yourself from the dream before it can fully claim you. You awaken with a gasp, heart pounding, mind reeling from what nearly transpired. Though you escaped the worst of it, fragments of cosmic awareness linger at the edges of your consciousness  a glimpse of truths no mortal was meant to comprehend.

rootNode.text: The air chills as you approach the silent figure, shrouded in tattered robes, a hood obscuring its face. A lantern swings gently from its bony grasp, casting eerie shadows. "Welcome, traveler. What do you seek in these solemn halls?"

children.text: "I am but a guide for the souls who journey between realms. I dwell here, at the edge of worlds, to serve those who seek passage."

children.choiceLabel: Are you an arachnid as well?

children.text: "No, I am not one of the embalmers. They have long since lost their purpose, I still retain mine."
"No more so than your weapon is evil, [[class]]. My services are but a tool, an intermediate in plans far greater than yours or mine."

children.choiceLabel: What do you guide souls to?

children.text: "The other side is where souls and secrets find their final rest, or perhaps a new beginning. A place of redemption, and an answer to lifes most pressing question."
"Ah, one most potent [[class]]. A force that could vanquish all demons, and redeem this world. I cannot say more."
The Ferryman merely stares at you.
"The toll is exact: two for the dead, fifty coins of passing for the living. It is the price for a journey to the other side or deeper into these sacred halls."

children.choiceLabel: I want to go to the other side. Can you take me?

children.text: "Only those who possess the full toll may pass. Do you have the fifty coins of passing?"

You present the full count of coins. The Ferryman weighs them in his skeletal hand, then nods solemnly. "The toll is paid. Step aboard." The boat creaks as you step onto it, the black waters lapping against the sides. You glide silently through the dark river, tombs lining the banks like silent sentinels.

The Ferryman rows with a steady pace, each stroke cutting through the water like a whisper. As you proceed, the path descends steeply, the air growing colder, heavier. You're heading into a vast tomb, its gaping maw swallowing the light from the Ferryman's lantern. With a final nod, the Ferryman gestures towards the dark descent. "This is where my journey ends, and yours will be decided. Until next time, wanderer." You step off the boat onto a cold, stone platform. Ahead, darkness beckons, almost as if calling your name. You move forward, descending into the secrets of the inner sanctum, a chance of redemption weighing heavy on your shoulders.

children.choiceLabel: I want to go to the other side. Can you take me?

children.text: "Only those who possess the full toll may pass. Do you have the fifty coins of passing?"

You present the full count of coins. The Ferryman weighs them in his skeletal hand, then nods solemnly. "The toll is paid. Step aboard." The boat creaks as you step onto it, the black waters lapping against the sides. You glide silently through the dark river, tombs lining the banks like silent sentinels.

The Ferryman rows with a steady pace, each stroke cutting through the water like a whisper. As you proceed, the path descends steeply, the air growing colder, heavier. You're heading into a vast tomb, its gaping maw swallowing the light from the Ferryman's lantern. With a final nod, the Ferryman gestures towards the dark descent. "This is where my journey ends, and yours will be decided. Until next time, wanderer." You step off the boat onto a cold, stone platform. Ahead, darkness beckons, almost as if calling your name. "The toll is exact: two for the dead, fifty coins of passing for the living. It is the price for a journey to the other side or deeper into these sacred halls."

children.choiceLabel: I want to go to the other side. Can you take me?

children.text: "Only those who possess the full toll may pass. Do you have the fifty coins of passing?"

You present the full count of coins. The Ferryman weighs them in his skeletal hand, then nods solemnly. "The toll is paid. Step aboard." The boat creaks as you step onto it, the black waters lapping against the sides. You glide silently through the dark river, tombs lining the banks like silent sentinels.

The Ferryman rows with a steady pace, each stroke cutting through the water like a whisper. As you proceed, the path descends steeply, the air growing colder, heavier. You're heading into a vast tomb, its gaping maw swallowing the light from the Ferryman's lantern. With a final nod, the Ferryman gestures towards the dark descent. "This is where my journey ends, and yours will be decided. Until next time, wanderer." You step off the boat onto a cold, stone platform. Ahead, darkness beckons, almost as if calling your name. You move forward, descending into the secrets of the inner sanctum, a chance of redemption weighing heavy on your shoulders.

"These are the Halls of Silent Saints, a resting place for souls and secrets. It is here that many come seeking passage to the other side, bearing the coins of passing."

children.choiceLabel: Coins of passing? What are those?

children.text: "The coins of passing are tokens of life's weight, a toll for the journey ahead. Each soul carries them, and they are required to traverse the river to the other side."
"Two for the dead. For the living, fifty coins are needed. No less will suffice. They are the currency of passage, the weight of a soul's journey."
"No."

children.choiceLabel: I think I have the coins.
