rootNode.text: A large forge burns with a bright blue flame, lick of the fire promising arcane rewards in return for mundane weapons.

children.choiceLabel: Warm your hands by the fire
Throw a weapon in the fire

children.text: The forge consumes the weapon with obvious delight before returning the reforged ashes its new form.

rootNode.text: A shimmering tear hangs in the air before you, pulsing with an otherworldly light. The air around it distorts, and whispers that bypass your ears speak directly to your mind. Near the anomaly rests a small altar with a cracked obsidian orb, its surface etched with symbols that hurt to look at directly.

children.text: Your trained mind begins to decipher the impossible geometry of the symbols. As understanding floods in, so does madness  knowledge no mortal was meant to possess. "THE CURIOUS MIND OPENS ITSELF." Images flood your consciousness: vast beings swimming between stars, a hunger that spans universes, and your world as merely one layer of infinite realities being slowly consumed.

You reach toward the shimmering anomaly. The moment your fingers make contact, cold fire races up your arm. Reality bends around you as something from beyond peers through the opening you've widened. "THE VESSEL MAKES CONTACT. THE CYCLE CONTINUES." A tendril of shadow extends through the tear, caressing your face with impossible gentleness.

With decisive force, you bring your weapon down upon the obsidian orb. It shatters with a sound like reality itself cracking, releasing a burst of black energy that dissipates into the air. The tear flickers violently, contracting as if in pain. "TEMPORARY SETBACK. BRUTE FORCE... UNEXPECTED." The Ritual has been interrupted! The presence retreats, its whispers fading. You sense you've delayed whatever was attempting to manifest, though not permanently.

With nimble fingers, you carefully lift the orb from the altar, avoiding the fractures along its surface. As you remove it, the tear in reality wavers, losing stability without its anchor. "THE CONDUIT DISPLACED. RECALIBRATION REQUIRED." The Ritual has been delayed! The whispers fade as the tear slowly closes. Whatever entity was attempting to cross over has been temporarily thwarted by your dexterous intervention.

Some primal instinct warns you away. As you turn to leave, the whispers grow more insistent, almost desperate. "AWARENESS CANNOT BE UNLEARNED. YOU CARRY US NOW." The Ritual moves closer to completion! That night, your dreams are filled with vast, cold spaces between stars and entities that watch from impossible angles. You awaken uncertain whether you truly escapedor merely postponed an inevitable encounter.

rootNode.text: You encounter a small lake, frozen over by the harsh weather. At the center of the lake, a tall statue reaches for the skies. A twinkle from between her outstretched fingers catches your eye.

children.text: As you look closer, the twinkling appears to be a steady stream of solid gold flowing from between the statues hands like a fountain.
The ice cracks and creaks underneath your feet, snickering at every step you take. As you move halfway across the lake, the ice suddenly starts to give in.

As you start to run back, the creaking becomes a burst of laughter until, with a final leap, you narrowly escape the ice from swallowing you completely. In the distance, the twinkling gold turns a scarlet red.

The ice continues to crack and break underneath your feet until it gives in completely and plunges you into the icy water. Moments later you find yourself back on the edge of the lake. In the distance, the twinkle of gold turns a scarlet red.

The ice continues to crack and break underneath your feet until it gives in completely and plunges you into the icy water. Moments later you find yourself back on the edge of the lake. In the distance, the twinkle of gold turns a scarlet red.
You reach the small isle at the center of the lake with a dramatic final leap, narrowly escaping the water as you grab hold of the statues left arm.

The stone feels hot to the touch, and as you look more closely you notice the demonic features of an otherwise ordinary human woman, reaching for the sky while gold liquid flows freely between her fingers into a stone cup below.
The statue has a small plaque at its base, inscribed with barely legible symbols, crudely scratched into its gold surface. "To our wise and generous masters, may they get all they deserve."
You catch as much of the liquid gold as the cup will hold. As you turn back, you notice the lake is now no longer covered with ice but with what looks to be solid gold.
You make your way back to the shore, and as you take your final step the lake turns back to ice, and the gold starts to flow once more from between the fingers of the statues outstretched hand.

rootNode.text: The creature shrieks, green mist from its putrid, insect-like body. You feel the released Anima coalesce, gathering in one of the large phylacteries inside its horrific lair.

children.text: Suddenly, a loud crack suddenly breaks though the piercing winds, quickly followed by a screeching howl. "No! NO! NO, no no- ours-" the joyful screams turn to despair, fading rapidly as its attention seems to shift away from you until you no longer feel its presence. Reghar looms over the shattered phylacteries, his hammer still embedded in one of the strange contraptions as he observes the Anima dissipate uncontrollably. "That's for Kivos, you bastard," he declares with a steely gaze.

children.choiceLabel: Let all of the anima escape

children.text: As you look up, vivid green streaks of light shoot up towards the dark sky. Each beam penetrates the clouds, allowing sunlight to spill onto the Godscar Wastes and drench the terrifying landscape with its healing glow. Though an unsettling presence lingers, you feel it has been significantly weakened, loosening its suffocating grip on your soul and revitalising your entire being. You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

children.choiceLabel: Consume only part of the Anima

children.text: The mysterious essence swirls around the broken containers, then suddenly beams of light shoot up into the dark clouds above. As you watch, you can sense its power getting weaker, but not before you tap into some of the essence yourself. The essence seems to beckon to your curiosity, almost eager to lend some of its strength to you, knowing that it will empower you for the battles ahead. You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

children.choiceLabel: Holy: Release all of the Anima

children.text: As you stand amidst the barren wastelands, you become acutely aware of the powerful force stirring all around you. The Anima yearns to break free from the unnatural shackles that bind this misery to the Wastes itself.

Streaks of light shoot upwards, igniting the sky with a mesmerising display of crimson and gold against the dark emerald horizon. Brilliant streams of light dance around you, and a deep sense of gratefulness washes over you. You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

Streaks of light shoot upwards, igniting the sky with a mesmerising display of crimson and gold against the dark emerald horizon. Brilliant streams of light dance around you, weaving a mystical aura that imbues your sword with a powerful radiance. You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

The whisper returns in your ear, soft at first, as if injured a great dealthen get louder and louder until they shriek in delight. "Feed usssss champion!" A black void spreads, engulfing everything in its path as it morphs into tendrils of darkness, creeping towards you with malice.

The dark mass seems to burrow beneath your very flesh, merging with your very being in a terrifying dance. As the pain sbusides, a sudden strength courses through your body, imbuing you with a feeling of power, invincibility and a dark hunger... You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

Its oily touch feels suffocating at first, but is soon diverted to your sword. The once-beautiful blade becomes a symbol of agony and despair, its power fuelled by the tortured souls of those who perished in these wastelands. You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

The Unleashed Anima, a vivid green swirl, engulfs you. Howling voices taunt you, "Hungry, thief?" It gasps, "Then feast!" Malicious tendrils lash out, creeping into your soul until none remain. You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

"We found it! How did it hide? It matters not, it is food now. FOOD! Yes- our food!" The stoic old mage swings around, and you can see the fear in his deep set eyes. "Stay back!" "It will be our food! Yes! Yes more food! More- it will be enough!" Your head starts to spin as a stinging pain starts to wash over you. The howling winds seem everywhere, lifting the body of the fallen matron first before it gets shred into numerous pieces as screams of joy surround you from every angle... Suddenly, a loud crack suddenly breaks though the piercing winds, quickly followed by a screeching howl. "No! NO! NO, no no- ours-" the joyful screams turn to despair, fading rapidly as its attention seems to shift away from you until you no longer feel its presence. Reghar looms over the shattered phylacteries, his hammer still embedded in one of the strange contraptions as he observes the Anima dissipate uncontrollably. "That's for Kivos, you bastard," he declares with a steely gaze.

children.choiceLabel: Let all of the anima escape

children.text: As you look up, vivid green streaks of light shoot up towards the dark sky. Each beam penetrates the clouds, allowing sunlight to spill onto the Godscar Wastes and drench the terrifying landscape with its healing glow. Though an unsettling presence lingers, you feel it has been significantly weakened, loosening its suffocating grip on your soul and revitalising your entire being. You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

children.choiceLabel: Consume only part of the Anima

children.text: The mysterious essence swirls around the broken containers, then suddenly beams of light shoot up into the dark clouds above. As you watch, you can sense its power getting weaker, but not before you tap into some of the essence yourself. The essence seems to beckon to your curiosity, almost eager to lend some of its strength to you, knowing that it will empower you for the battles ahead. You take a deep breath, relieved to have survived the trials of the Wastes. The Dark Citadel stands tall in the distance, looming over the barren land and beckoning you to your next destination.

children.choiceLabel: Holy: Release all of the Anima

rootNode.text: You stand in a barren wasteland, where massive bones protrude from the rocky terrain like ancient tombstones. The sky above glows a sickly green, casting an ominous pall over the eerie silence.

children.text: Bolar looks up at the emerald sky. "This isn't some demon, [[class]]. We've entered the domain of Serem-Pek. A predator that feeds on misery itself." I'll be able to keep it at bay for a while, hiding our presence. But it will take a toll on me, I will not be able to offer any more Imbues."
Bolgar waves his crooked staff above his head, a green circle forming around you as previously invisible black tendrils collide with its shimmering shell. "This should do, but we best keep moving..."

children.choiceLabel: I want to consider other options

children.text: You stand in a barren wasteland, where massive bones protrude from the rocky terrain like ancient tombstones. The sky above glows a sickly green, casting an ominous pall over the eerie silence.
Whatever looms over this place, the Lady of Mercy keeps it well hidden from my sight. Perhaps we can use this to hide our own presence as well.

children.choiceLabel: Sacrifice a random card: Receive Viola's blessing

children.text: The priestess starts a chant, solemnly lighting the card you offered and inviting you to join her in a brief prayer. After a few moments, you feel the looming presence lose its grasp on you, rebuked a sacred ward.

children.choiceLabel: I want to consider other options

children.text: You stand in a barren wasteland, where massive bones protrude from the rocky terrain like ancient tombstones. The sky above glows a sickly green, casting an ominous pall over the eerie silence.

Do you feel it, [[class]]? Real power lingers here. And while I would normally be more than willing to investigate, something tells me we are better off not interfering with this particular beast. I might have a potion that could shield us from its gaze - simple in nature but it requires some of my most expensive components...
Theresa smiles as she hands you the freshly brewed concoction. "Drink while it's still hot. It won't make it more effective, but it will taste better." she adds with a playful wink.

children.choiceLabel: I want to consider other options

children.text: You stand in a barren wasteland, where massive bones protrude from the rocky terrain like ancient tombstones. The sky above glows a sickly green, casting an ominous pall over the eerie silence.
"Ahh. We've already been introduced..." a whisper suddenly appears in your mind, multiple voices coalescing as they seem to swirl around you.
The voice carries an unmistakable air of power and authority, but its intentions remain unclear. You can't help but feel a sense of unease as it speaks, unsure of whether to trust its words.

The voices rise again, their tone now tinged with sorrow and regret. "We are not of this world," they say. "We were once visitors, like you. But circumstances beyond our control trapped us here, in this accursed wasteland." The voices pause, as if remembering some great tragedy. "We have searched for a way out for aeons, but to no avail. And so, we have made this place our own."

Amidst the maddening voices that swirl around you, a singular voice rises above the rest. It is deep and commanding, yet somehow soothing in its tone. "Fear not, wanderer," the voice says. "We seek only to guide you through these treacherous lands and avoid you sharing our unfortunate fate." As the voices trail off, you feel a sense of kinship with them - a shared desire to escape the wasteland and find a way back to the world beyond.

The voices grow louder, more frenzied. "This land is special to us," they say. "It sustains us - all the suffering of a dying god bled out into the soil, animating whatever touches this essence." "You can help us," they say, their voice dripping with malice. "Bring us more of this essence, and we will make you strong - stronger than you could ever imagine. Together, we can rule this wasteland and beyond!"

The voices fall silent, and you can feel their anger simmering beneath the surface. "It questions us! It does not trust us?" they ask, their words laced with fury, their rage building with each passing moment. You feel their power coalescing around you like a maelstrom. "If you will not accept our aid," they say, their voices rising to a crescendo. "then you'll perish here like all the others before you!"

Bolar looks up at the emerald sky. "This isn't some demon, [[class]]. We've entered the domain of Serem-Pek. A predator that feeds on misery itself." I'll be able to keep it at bay for a while, hiding our presence. But it will take a toll on me, I will not be able to offer any more Imbues."
Bolgar waves his crooked staff above his head, a green circle forming around you as previously invisible black tendrils collide with its shimmering shell. "This should do, but we best keep moving..."

"You can help us," they say, their voice dripping with malice. "Bring us more of this essence, and we will make you strong - stronger than you could ever imagine. Together, we can rule this wasteland and beyond!"

The voices fall silent, and you can feel their anger simmering beneath the surface. "It questions us! It does not trust us?" they ask, their words laced with fury, their rage building with each passing moment. You feel their power coalescing around you like a maelstrom. "If you will not accept our aid," they say, their voices rising to a crescendo. "then you'll perish here like all the others before you!"

Bolar looks up at the emerald sky. "This isn't some demon, [[class]]. We've entered the domain of Serem-Pek. A predator that feeds on misery itself." I'll be able to keep it at bay for a while, hiding our presence. But it will take a toll on me, I will not be able to offer any more Imbues."
Bolgar waves his crooked staff above his head, a green circle forming around you as previously invisible black tendrils collide with its shimmering shell. "This should do, but we best keep moving..."

children.choiceLabel: I want to consider other options

children.text: You stand in a barren wasteland, where massive bones protrude from the rocky terrain like ancient tombstones. The sky above glows a sickly green, casting an ominous pall over the eerie silence.
Whatever looms over this place, the Lady of Mercy keeps it well hidden from my sight. Perhaps we can use this to hide our own presence as well.

children.choiceLabel: Sacrifice a random card: Receive Viola's blessing

children.text: The priestess starts a chant, solemnly lighting the card you offered and inviting you to join her in a brief prayer. After a few moments, you feel the looming presence lose its grasp on you, rebuked a sacred ward.

Do you feel it, [[class]]? Real power lingers here. And while I would normally be more than willing to investigate, something tells me we are better off not interfering with this particular beast. I might have a potion that could shield us from its gaze - simple in nature but it requires some of my most expensive components...
Theresa smiles as she hands you the freshly brewed concoction. "Drink while it's still hot. It won't make it more effective, but it will taste better." she adds with a playful wink.

"Ahh. We've already been introduced..." a whisper suddenly appears in your mind, multiple voices coalescing as they seem to swirl around you.
The voice carries an unmistakable air of power and authority, but its intentions remain unclear. You can't help but feel a sense of unease as it speaks, unsure of whether to trust its words.

The voices rise again, their tone now tinged with sorrow and regret. "We are not of this world," they say. "We were once visitors, like you. But circumstances beyond our control trapped us here, in this accursed wasteland." The voices pause, as if remembering some great tragedy. "We have searched for a way out for aeons, but to no avail. And so, we have made this place our own."

Amidst the maddening voices that swirl around you, a singular voice rises above the rest. It is deep and commanding, yet somehow soothing in its tone. "Fear not, wanderer," the voice says. "We seek only to guide you through these treacherous lands and avoid you sharing our unfortunate fate." As the voices trail off, you feel a sense of kinship with them - a shared desire to escape the wasteland and find a way back to the world beyond.

rootNode.text: In this mystical place filled with peculiar creatures and intriguing visuals, a figure with human-like features stands before a large crystalline shard.

children.text: She pulls down the white hood of her Candorian robes and appears just as startled as you to see another human. "Hail stranger, I am Viola Skysword, priestess of the White Rose, and personal guide to the Dawnbringer... or I was."
The Dawnbringer is our champion of the light. The one who will free us from darkness I'm surprised you have not heard of him - we must truly be far away from home.

I was part of the Dawnbringer's entourage. We were searching for a way into the Black Citadel when the dead rose up to fight us. I got separated and ended up getting lost. After a night in a terrible swamp, Rae showed me a vision, a means of catching up to Corre... the Dawnbringer by travelling through this strange place.

The priestess looks up at the tall stone shard. "I don't know yet. Some seem to tell tales I only know from my studies, reliving them like they happened yesterday.They must be the key to finding my way back to the side of the Dawnbringer."
Yes we should. Perhaps we might succeed if we continue our search together. The light shines brightest where beams converge, does it not?
In exchange for a small donation, I can request Rae to provide her healing light to restore some of the wounds you sustained, or to purge any corruption from you.

children.choiceLabel: I don't need more sanctimonious lapdogs around me. You're on your own, priest.

children.text: The priestess steps back and seems genuinely caught off guard. "I see the light has truly abandoned you stranger. Know that Rae's mercy knows no bounds, just as she has given humanity itself a second chance, so can they be your salvation...

children.choiceLabel: We're better off each on our own.

children.text: Viola nods solemnly, then pulls her hood up over her head once more. "Farewell, and may the light guide you, [[class]], so we may both find what we are looking for."
Thank you, [[class]]. It gladdens me to see people take the Lady of Mercy even in a strange place like this. It brightens the spirit and rekindles hope, does it not?

Viola smiles brightly, bowing her head. "Rae, the Lady of Light, Mercy and Benevolence guides us all, whether we know it or not. She is the one that offered us a second chance after all seemed lost." After the world went dark with the death of Selandris, Aethos fell to corruption. Humanity lived in fear for thousands of years, and was all but wiped out. Until one day, Rae took notice and kindled a new sun, bestowing her own loving grace on Aethos itself. After the world went dark with the death of Selandris, Aethos fell to corruption. Humanity lived in fear for thousands of years, and was all but wiped out. Until one day, Rae took notice and kindled a new sun, bestowing her own loving grace on Aethos itself. At the very heart of the now luminated land lies Candor - a grand city like none other you've seen if you've not been there, stranger. My home, and seat of the Candorion church. And it delights me more than I can express to count you amongst us now.

Yes we should. Perhaps we might succeed if we continue our search together. The light shines brightest where beams converge, does it not?
In exchange for a small donation, I can request Rae to provide her healing light to restore some of the wounds you sustained, or to purge any corruption from you.

children.choiceLabel: I don't need more sanctimonious lapdogs around me. You're on your own, priest.

children.text: The priestess steps back and seems genuinely caught off guard. "I see the light has truly abandoned you stranger. Know that Rae's mercy knows no bounds, just as she has given humanity itself a second chance, so can they be your salvation...

children.choiceLabel: We're better off each on our own.

children.text: Viola nods solemnly, then pulls her hood up over her head once more. "Farewell, and may the light guide you, [[class]], so we may both find what we are looking for."
Thank you, [[class]]. It gladdens me to see people take the Lady of Mercy even in a strange place like this. It brightens the spirit and rekindles hope, does it not?

Viola smiles brightly, bowing her head. "Rae, the Lady of Light, Mercy and Benevolence guides us all, whether we know it or not. She is the one that offered us a second chance after all seemed lost." After the world went dark with the death of Selandris, Aethos fell to corruption. Humanity lived in fear for thousands of years, and was all but wiped out. Until one day, Rae took notice and kindled a new sun, bestowing her own loving grace on Aethos itself. After the world went dark with the death of Selandris, Aethos fell to corruption. Humanity lived in fear for thousands of years, and was all but wiped out. Until one day, Rae took notice and kindled a new sun, bestowing her own loving grace on Aethos itself. At the very heart of the now luminated land lies Candor - a grand city like none other you've seen if you've not been there, stranger. My home, and seat of the Candorion church. And it delights me more than I can express to count you amongst us now.

children.choiceLabel: Pray: Heal my wounds, Lady of Mercy

children.text: The White Rose bestows her Blessing, [[class]].

I was part of the Dawnbringer's entourage. We were searching for a way into the Black Citadel when the dead rose up to fight us. I got separated and ended up getting lost. After a night in a terrible swamp, Rae showed me a vision, a means of catching up to Corre... the Dawnbringer by travelling through this strange place.

She pulls down the white hood of her Candorian robes and appears just as startled as you to see another human. "Hail stranger, I am Viola Skysword, priestess of the White Rose, and personal guide to the Dawnbringer... or I was."
The Dawnbringer is our champion of the light. The one who will free us from darkness I'm surprised you have not heard of him - we must truly be far away from home.

The priestess looks up at the tall stone shard. "I don't know yet. Some seem to tell tales I only know from my studies, reliving them like they happened yesterday.They must be the key to finding my way back to the side of the Dawnbringer."
Yes we should. Perhaps we might succeed if we continue our search together. The light shines brightest where beams converge, does it not?
In exchange for a small donation, I can request Rae to provide her healing light to restore some of the wounds you sustained, or to purge any corruption from you.

children.choiceLabel: I don't need more sanctimonious lapdogs around me. You're on your own, priest.

children.text: The priestess steps back and seems genuinely caught off guard. "I see the light has truly abandoned you stranger. Know that Rae's mercy knows no bounds, just as she has given humanity itself a second chance, so can they be your salvation...

children.choiceLabel: We're better off each on our own.

Until one day, Rae took notice and kindled a new sun, bestowing her own loving grace on Aethos itself. After the world went dark with the death of Selandris, Aethos fell to corruption. Humanity lived in fear for thousands of years, and was all but wiped out. Until one day, Rae took notice and kindled a new sun, bestowing her own loving grace on Aethos itself. At the very heart of the now luminated land lies Candor - a grand city like none other you've seen if you've not been there, stranger. My home, and seat of the Candorion church. And it delights me more than I can express to count you amongst us now.

children.choiceLabel: 50 gold: Reduce my Maximum Health Penalty

children.text: Viola nods solemnly, then pulls her hood up over her head once more. "Farewell, and may the light guide you, [[class]], so we may both find what we are looking for."

children.choiceLabel: Pray: Heal my wounds, Lady of Mercy

children.text: The White Rose bestows her Blessing, [[class]].

The priestess looks up at the tall stone shard. "I don't know yet. Some seem to tell tales I only know from my studies, reliving them like they happened yesterday.They must be the key to finding my way back to the side of the Dawnbringer."

She pulls down the white hood of her Candorian robes and appears just as startled as you to see another human. "Hail stranger, I am Viola Skysword, priestess of the White Rose, and personal guide to the Dawnbringer... or I was."
The Dawnbringer is our champion of the light. The one who will free us from darkness I'm surprised you have not heard of him - we must truly be far away from home.

I was part of the Dawnbringer's entourage. We were searching for a way into the Black Citadel when the dead rose up to fight us. I got separated and ended up getting lost. After a night in a terrible swamp, Rae showed me a vision, a means of catching up to Corre... the Dawnbringer by travelling through this strange place.
Yes we should. Perhaps we might succeed if we continue our search together. The light shines brightest where beams converge, does it not?
In exchange for a small donation, I can request Rae to provide her healing light to restore some of the wounds you sustained, or to purge any corruption from you.

children.choiceLabel: I don't need more sanctimonious lapdogs around me. You're on your own, priest.

children.text: The priestess steps back and seems genuinely caught off guard. "I see the light has truly abandoned you stranger. Know that Rae's mercy knows no bounds, just as she has given humanity itself a second chance, so can they be your salvation...

children.choiceLabel: We're better off each on our own.

children.text: Viola nods solemnly, then pulls her hood up over her head once more. "Farewell, and may the light guide you, [[class]], so we may both find what we are looking for."

Thank you, [[class]]. It gladdens me to see people take the Lady of Mercy even in a strange place like this. It brightens the spirit and rekindles hope, does it not?

Viola smiles brightly, bowing her head. "Rae, the Lady of Light, Mercy and Benevolence guides us all, whether we know it or not. She is the one that offered us a second chance after all seemed lost." After the world went dark with the death of Selandris, Aethos fell to corruption. Humanity lived in fear for thousands of years, and was all but wiped out. Until one day, Rae took notice and kindled a new sun, bestowing her own loving grace on Aethos itself. After the world went dark with the death of Selandris, Aethos fell to corruption. Humanity lived in fear for thousands of years, and was all but wiped out. Until one day, Rae took notice and kindled a new sun, bestowing her own loving grace on Aethos itself. At the very heart of the now luminated land lies Candor - a grand city like none other you've seen if you've not been there, stranger. My home, and seat of the Candorion church. And it delights me more than I can express to count you amongst us now.

rootNode.text: You find yourself before roaring bonfire, skulls and bones char in the unnatural heat. A cast-iron pot hangs above the fire, illuminating a bubbling stew. A bone snaps, cracking like rotten wood in the flames.

children.text: The blazing heat beneath the pot scalds your arm as you stir the ladle still lingering inside the boney stew. A pale eye floats to the surface before it sinks into the vile brew once more.

The blazing heat beneath the pot scalds your arm as you stir the ladle still lingering inside the boney stew. A pale eye floats to the surface before it sinks into the vile brew once more. "That's... are those eyes? Whatever foul being we interrupted, they are truly beyond Rae's grace."

As the steaming pot tumbles onto the floor, it reveals its grimy content. Half-burned bones, eyes, and other indiscernible meats blend together into the foul, deep orange brew. "Bah, such a waste. Though it did need more cayenne peppers..."
Bones and meat fill the stew, flavored with pungent garlic. The first bites taste foul, and yet- it feels increasingly hard to lay down the grimy ladle, already reaching for another spoonful.

The priest stands agape, lips parted. "Revolting! Rae surely tests me more than most, [[class]] - I had thought such depraved acts beyond you!" Theresa perks a brow and smirks. "So quick to judge my dear - if your simplistic views of right and wrong are so easily challenged by pragmatism you'll not last long out here, child."

children.choiceLabel: Viola is right, my curiosity got the better of me - if victory meant becoming what we fight, that would be no victory at all.

children.text: The priestess smiles and raises her hand ceremoniously, offering a brief prayer and ignoring the disdainful glare of the Alchemist.

children.choiceLabel: Theresa is right, adhering to abstract concepts like right or wrong will only get in our way and will end up costing lives.

children.text: The alchemist smiles. "Ah, don't confuse our pretty flower with any more sensible thoughts. A few more and it might make her head explode." And as for you, this will help in the morning - you'll need it.

As you raise the ladle again, you barely recall how much you've had already, reaching down once more into the steaming kettle - only to have the spoon hit the bottom of the cast iron pot and a lingering hunger in your stomach...

rootNode.text: You finally reach the center of the crater. Before you stands the enigmatic burning tree, its flames casting an otherworldly glow yet leaving the tree unscathed. As you approach, you notice an old mage absorbed in his study of the tree. The mage, noticing your approach, turns to greet you. "Ah, another curious soul," he says with a warm smile. "I am Bolgar, a seeker of knowledge. This tree is a remarkable anomaly."

children.text: "What can you tell me about this tree?" you inquire. Bolgar strokes his beard thoughtfully. "It's as if the tree holds a fragment of a powerful, ancient force. Its flames are a mystery, burning but not consuming." As you and Bolgar discuss the tree's mysteries, the ground suddenly trembles. Bolgar's eyes widen in alarm. "Something's coming," he whispers.

children.choiceLabel: Ask Bolgar what he thinks it is

children.text: "What do you think it is?" you ask anxiously. Bolgar responds grimly, "Something drawn to the tree's power, no doubt. Be ready." The ground erupts as a massive three-headed hydra emerges, its eyes ablaze with hunger from the tree's power. It roars menacingly, turning its attention to you and Bolgar.

You brace yourself, ready to face whatever emerges. Bolgar stands beside you, his hands glowing with magical energy. The ground erupts as a massive three-headed hydra emerges, its eyes ablaze with hunger from the tree's power. It roars menacingly, turning its attention to you and Bolgar.

You introduce yourself to Bolgar. He listens intently, nodding in understanding. "It's always a pleasure to meet fellow seekers. What brings you to this unusual place?" As you and Bolgar discuss the tree's mysteries, the ground suddenly trembles. Bolgar's eyes widen in alarm. "Something's coming," he whispers.

rootNode.text: The sound of snow crunching beneath your feet echoes like a haunting anthem, the endless white of the landscape only broken by a scarlet trail leading to a nearby cave.

children.text: Wary of the life that would be able to survive this far into Umbris, you walk away from the scene.

You circle around the cave to avoid detection. Near the mouth of the cave you spot a wounded huntress, an arrow lodged into her leg. At the far end of the cave, you spot another hunter nocking another arrow. Though the two figures share the same marks, it is clear this is not a friendly conversation.
Whatever is going on here, this isn't your fight.
"You can't hide forever..." The tracker makes a gesture towards the wounded huntress before going limp.

The huntress grunts as she pushes herself up, leaning against the stone wall of the small cavern. She spits on the dead tracker's corpse, then tightens the grip on her bow. "You have no idea what youve gotten yourself into, stranger."
"I'm fine, stranger. You best worry about yourself if you plan on going through the pass."
"I am Maki, of the... she pauses, and relaxes the grip on her bow - "Just Maki."
"Nothing that concerns you, outsider." The huntress takes an awkward step forward then grimaces and pauses. "What about you? There is nothing up here for you, nothing good."

The huntress looks confused for a moment. "This is a dangerous place to get lost, stranger. Whatever your purpose, I know a village not far from here. Perhaps a swig of Roshin's ale will refresh your memory."

The huntress smiles. "Fair enough, outlander - we both keep our secrets. My village is not far from here, I will guide you there." she states, putting one foot in front of the other, visibly biting through the pain.

children.choiceLabel: I need to reach the Onyx Cathedral

children.text: Maki hesitates for a moment, looking you over. "Then we are equally foolish." she smiles and puts another foot in front of the other. "But as fools, it's best we stay together until we get back to my village- try to keep up."

You stare at the corpse of the young huntress, unsure of what to make of her. Whatever these inhospitable lands had in store for her, it ended in a more gruesome way than she likely deserved.

rootNode.text: A collection of massive orange crystals stands out from its dark surroundings, casting strange shadows upon the stone walls.

children.text: You tentatively move towards the closest of the orange clusters. Gazing into the warm light of the amber jewel, you notice a remarkably humanoid shape trapped within the vibrant resin.

Your [[weapon]] strikes the strange formation. Thin cracks start to form as an overpowering sense of anguish starts to fill your soul. Suddenly, a thick, black mist coalesces behind you and a clawed hand reaches for your weapon.

The demon scowls, pointing a finger at her eyes. Look, but don't touch! Is that too much to ask?. The demon briefly glances at the crystal before wrapping a protective arm around the figure stepping out of the dark mist next to her.
"Me?" the succubus smiles, flicks her tail low to the ground, and pats the head of the ensorcelled and cloaked priest at her side. "They want to know about little Serena! Isn't that sweet, puppet?"
The 'puppet' wears the trappings of a priest of the White Rose. Despite the lack of crystals on her, she seems to be under the same spell most of the denizens in these caves have succumbed to.

children.choiceLabel: Release these poor souls at once!

children.text: "Now why would I do that? You can't bully me like old Bad Temper up in his castle. If you want to play with my puppets, come find me!"
The black smoke swirls once more, whisking the demon and her 'puppet' away, leaving you back in the strangely illuminated hallways of the Ambermines.

"Crazy? CRAZY? That's not very nice. Is it, puppet?" the demon smiles a deadly smile. Not nice at all. The demoness turns the priestess's head left to right with her sharp-nailed fingers. "Show them some manners, puppet!"

The priest stands dazed for a moment as the demonesss influence visibly subsides. "I... I thank you, [[class]]. That was a noble thing to do. Not many here have the willpower to stand up to that demoness. These crystals amplify her suggestions. Or perhaps, she amplifies the crystals suggestions.

"We... I mean, I was part of the Dawnbringer's entourage. We were searching for a way into the Black Citadel when a demoness attacked us." "And then the Dawnbringer just... left us! I couldn't believe my eyes as he fled into one of the tunnels."
"I don't know - there must be something down there he needed very much. There was something in his eyes that... frightened me."
The priest nods, and hands you a Sun-shaped amulet. "The White Rose shall aid you, hero. May this amulet aid you in the journey ahead. I shall pray that Rae looks kindly upon your quest."
"I don't know - there must be something down there he needed very much. There was something in his eyes that... frightened me."
The priest nods, and hands you a Sun-shaped amulet. "The White Rose shall aid you, hero. May this amulet aid you in the journey ahead. I shall pray that Rae looks kindly upon your quest."
"Not so fast! Why don't we have some fun first? Come find me, and maybe - MAYBE - we can make a deal! Maybe not. Maybe I'll just make you my puppet instead! You seem pretty."
The black smoke swirls once more, whisking the demon and her 'puppet' away, leaving you back in the strangely illuminated hallways of the Ambermines.

"She's a pretty puppet, isn't she? She gazes into the entrapped womans eyes. I wanted to get the other one too, but he got away. Nearly took my hand off! she pauses, biting her lip and daydreaming a bit.

"She's a pretty puppet, isn't she? She gazes into the entrapped womans eyes. I wanted to get the other one too, but he got away. Nearly took my hand off! she pauses, biting her lip and daydreaming a bit.
"Y'got the right idea, [[class]], best steer clear of those. Reghar worked with many-a-stone, but this is something else. Jus' something wrong with it and I cannae put me finger on it."

rootNode.text: Wading deeper and deeper into the woods, a high-pitched cry breaks the silence.

children.text: Between the gnarly roots of a unusually large tree, one of the druids chants ominously over a bloodied altar. On the scarlet slab of stone a familiar looking face struggles against his confinements. "Mhnngngggg!"

Without another sound, you close in on the bloody scene until you are close enough to strike. After the dust has settled, a familiar face steps out from behind the shrine. "Ah it's you. How... embarrassing."

We just set out to seize upon this unexplored opportunity. The Emporium has had its eyes on the borderland locals for a while now, but has yet to gain a foothold here. Of course, if anyone could do it, it would be Julius Bellthorp! But once we approached the... brutes! They merely 'inquired' about our means to subdue some kind of spirit, to siphon its power or some nonsense. Which meant they needed the Ephemeral Interventions, which is an entirely different department within the Emporium. Fortunately, they had an alternative offer; wanting my blood and bones. As we were working out the details, their impatience turned to violence and... well here we are.

Julius nods, collecting his scattered belongings and gathering his remaining dignity. Before we go, you wouldnt be in the market for some first-grade, if not *slightly* damaged cards would you? It is the least we could do."

children.choiceLabel: As a matter of fact, I am.
I... am not even going to ask

children.text: Before we go, you wouldnt be in the market for some first-grade, if not *slightly* damaged cards would you? It is the least we could do."

children.choiceLabel: As a matter of fact, I am.

rootNode.text: A rather unremarkable gravestone stands somewhat crooked over a patch of soil.

children.text: You dig into the shallow grave, quickly uncovering a small stash of items.
You extend a hand and whisper a prayer to the Sungod. The small patch of soil lights up briefly.
You sense a restless spirit atop the freshly dug grave. It seems desperate to communicate with you.
The spirit senses you too, forming a strange connection through which you appear to understand its thoughts, if only partially. "We can not pass... Warden wants us to stay... Please help us..."
The spirits thoughts seem to intensify, conveying both a sense of extreme exhaustion and anger.

children.choiceLabel: I will do what I can

children.text: The feeling of dread and anxiousness fades, and is replaced by a sensation of hope and gratitude.
The soul seems all to eager to leave this place, and you feel its presense strengthen your own.

rootNode.text: A pair of glowing red eyes observe you from the darkness.

children.text: "YOU!" an imp with a big smile on its face reveals itself. "NEED SOME HELP?"
"BARGAINS! I LESSEN ROT FOR VERY LOW PRICE. YOU KILL NASTY PEST DEMONS. DEAL?"
Rot is decreased by 50.

rootNode.text: As you walk down the dimly lit hallway, your eyes can barely make out the various paintings and tapestries that line the walls. The air is thick with the scent of old wood and musty fabric. As you near the end of the hallway, you spot a massive door made of thick steel, with intricate runes and symbols etched into its surface.

children.text: The entry to the vault is a massive door made of thick steel, reinforced with intricate runes and symbols etched into its surface. The handle is made of solid gold, and it is shaped like a serpent coiled around the lock, with its mouth open to reveal the keyhole. It is evident that great care has been taken to protect what lies beyond it.

You prepare your tools and carefully examine the vault door. As soon as the thin needle slides into the complex mechanism you begin to feel for the tumblers, delicately manoeuvring them into the correct position. After a few moments, your lockpick seems unable to reach the final tumbler, scratching against the metal without finding purchase.

Your finger pushes onto the metal pin, feeling it latch onto the the final tumbler before you start to turn it with considerable effort. Finally, after what seems like an eternity, it clicks into place, and the lock gives way. As you step into the vault, your eyes widen in amazement at the sheer amount of treasure stored within. The walls are lined with shelves, each one overflowing with glittering gold coins, sparkling jewels, and precious artifacts from distant lands.

children.choiceLabel: Take as much gold as you can carry.
Look for magic artifacts or items.
Push the lockpick in all the way

children.text: You push the lockpick down the gilded lock. For a moment, the metal pin seems to find purchase, before the coiled serpent suddenly moves and snaps at your hand, sinking its poisonous fangs deep into your skin. You have been Poisoned and start next combat with 5 Poison!

Approaching the vault, you notice the magical seals etched on the door. You begin to chant softly, focusing on the first seal. As you speak the arcane words that match its symbol, it fades away. You move on to the next, each requiring a different incantation. After a few brief moments, only one seal remains. You hesitate, unsure of the nature of this seals magic...

As you access your memory, you realise the rune is not arcane in nature at all. The rune is a trap, no doubt triggering some kind of alarm the moment it was dispelled. Realising this, you press your hand against the heavy door, only to find it already unlocked as it swings open. As you step into the vault, your eyes widen in amazement at the sheer amount of treasure stored within. The walls are lined with shelves, each one overflowing with glittering gold coins, sparkling jewels, and precious artifacts from distant lands.

children.choiceLabel: Take as much gold as you can carry.
Look for magic artifacts or items.

children.text: The rune seems to faintly resemble the arcane word for 'enter'. As you begin to chant the word, it doesn't take long to recognize the carefully laid trap however, a loud ringing sound breaking your concentration as a ghostly apparition rushes towards you!
[Combat]
You take a deep breath, centering yourself before unleashing your full strength onto the door. You start to push and feel the hinges start to bend, but not budge...

With a loud creaking sound, the metal begins to give way under your immense pressure. You feel the vibrations course through your entire body as you continue to push. Suddenly, there's a loud crack and the door bursts open. As you step into the vault, your eyes widen in amazement at the sheer amount of treasure stored within. The walls are lined with shelves, each one overflowing with glittering gold coins, sparkling jewels, and precious artifacts from distant lands.

children.choiceLabel: Take as much gold as you can carry.
Look for magic artifacts or items.

children.text: You raise your weapon before bringing it down with tremendous force on the gilded serpent around the lock. It bends, leaving a firm dent in the gold, but does not give in...

rootNode.text: An arcane sigil suddenly lights up below your feet. In a circle all around you, a wall made out of fire starts burning, trapping you inside.

children.text: You boldly rush through the barrier of flames, escaping the fiery entrapment, though not without paying the price. You are burning.
You boldly rush through the barrier of flames, escaping the fiery entrapment without harm.
Using your arcane knowledge you manage to seal off the magical energy that was powering the sigil, causing the fiery wall to quickly dissipate.

children.choiceLabel: Put a card on the sigil

children.text: The cards starts absorbing the magical energy powering the trap. The energy swirls around the card, before being absorbed by it, adding an unexpected effect to the card.

rootNode.text: You encounter a window with soft warm hues and gentle strokes, depicting a scene of serenity, offering a helping hand and comforting embrace.

children.text: In the realm of mortal existence, I find solace in the gentle embrace of contemplation. Yet, as I dwell upon the nature of compassion, a realization takes holdan immortal being could never truly embody its essence.

Compassion, a profound empathy that flows from the depths of mortal hearts, is intertwined with the awareness of a shared vulnerability. It is nurtured by the understanding of the ephemeral nature of life, the interconnectedness of all beings, and the recognition of suffering as a universal experience.

rootNode.text: Your eye catches a window with a bold arrangement of vibrant colors, bringing to life scenes of a valiant warrior standing tall in the face of adversity. Their eyes filled with so much determination you can almost feel the resolute spirit emanating from the glass.

children.text: In the realm of mortal existence, I find solace in the gentle embrace of contemplation. Yet, as I dwell upon the nature of courage, a realization takes holdan immortal being could never truly embody its essence.

Immortality, the eternal embrace of existence unbounded by the constraints of time, whispers promises of invulnerability and everlasting life. It tempts us with the illusion of perpetual safety, shielding us from the inherent risks and uncertainties that accompany mortal fragility. Yet, in this seeming sanctuary, courage languishes.

rootNode.text: You come across a tall window, intricate patterns and delicate shades of purple and silver depicting wise sages and scholars immersed in the pursuit of knowledge.

children.text: In the realm of mortal existence, I find solace in the gentle embrace of contemplation. Yet, as I dwell upon the nature of wisdom, a realization takes hold; An immortal being could never truly embody its essence.

Behold the river of time, ceaselessly flowing, carrying us through the cycles of existence. In this flowing current, wisdom reveals itself, born of the interplay between our transient nature and the consequences of our actions. It is within this dance of impermanence that the true essence of wisdom takes root.

rootNode.text: Howling winds sweep across the land; grit cuts your face, a stinging and thunderous assault on your bare skin. The sudden gale forces you to find shelter, a nearby hillock promises the hope of protection from the storm.

children.text: Hands raised against the howling wind, you stagger towards a nearby hillock. The wind beats against whatever shelter is available, banishing any possibility of warming yourself by a fire.

Muttering a curse, you unwrap your medical kit, and wrap your cut and bleeding hands and face, picking out the largest shards of stone and grit from the bleeding cuts. As the winds howl, eventually the worst of the pain fades and the bandages do their work.

children.choiceLabel: Raise your shield for additional shelter.

children.text: You plant your shield firmly into the ground and take cover. It doesn't take long for the storm to pick up, dirt and grit hammering at the make-shift shelter, pummeling the iron bounds until they give in, yet allowing you to emerge unscathed.

A swift prayer sent heavenward fills you with a calm resolve as you watch the storm, whipping sand and grit through the air. Surely the hand of the gods can be seen in such displays as you reckon with the insignificance of humanity on this world.

The storm howls, whipping sand and grit through the air. From your leeward shelter, the display seems almost beautiful, unbroken, and filled with a terrible majesty before it settles several hours later.

children.choiceLabel: Raise your arms up to the sky

children.text: The wind starts to howl, almost as if affronted by your defiance. The rapidly darkening sky stares down threateningly before thick tendrils of lightning suddenly jolt downwards. But as the thunderous crackle subsides, you are left standing, the energy fully absorbed but for the tiny coils still swirling around your fingertips.

The wind starts to howl, almost as if affronted by your defiance. The rapidly darkening sky stares down threateningly before thick tendrils of lightning suddenly jolt downwards. Almost as if in terror, new bolts of lightning recoil from your position before the storm retreats, leaving you unscathed and triumphant.

Almost as if in terror, new bolts of lightning recoil from your position before the storm retreats, leaving you unscathed and triumphant.

children.choiceLabel: Point your axe at the sky

Shards of sand and dust cut into your exposed face and hands. Grit embeds itself deep beneath your skin, leaving you bleeding from dozens of scratches and furrows. As the storm settles, you feel your face permanently marked by the unusually harsh conditions of Umbris...

rootNode.text: A young, wounded boar cries out in pain and fear, its hoof trapped by two large iron claws.

children.choiceLabel: Hunter: Kill and skin the animal

children.text: You skin the animal with expert craftsmanship, fashioning yourself an extra layer of padding for your armor.
The wounded animal doesnt resist as you strike it with a swift blow, putting it out of its misery. Itll make for a nice roast to sustain you on your journey ahead.
The animal whimpers meekly as you set it free. It awkwardly takes its first few steps as a free animal, leaving a messy trail of blood.
You pour the healing potion into the young animals mouth. It resists at first, but as the healing effects take hold, it starts to skip and leap happily around at your feet.
